description:
If you are ever anywhere near this little hole-in-the-wall café, immediately stop & find some parking. Try one of their hell-aciously delicious cheese steak sandwiches, except during lunch when this place gets crushed by the locals. 

There's a small seating area and the owner/employees are genuinely polite & friendly. A nice combination like that goes along with their dyn-O-mite product.

Huge, juicy, and flavorful sandwiches here. Don't forget their crispy waffle fries, along with a soft drink. That is a wonderful thing. I used to work nearby, but no longer. I have a hole in my food heart whenever I get the craving for a cheese steak sando and think of V Café. 

If I am anywhere near this place and with even a hint of hunger hanging around (and it's not lunchtime: 11AM-1PM) I will indeed make the time for their creations. Yelp folks you won't regret it. 

As an old TV ad once said: 
Try it, You'll like it!
author: william s.

description:
Such a delicious sandwich! Staff is really friendly, just not a huge fan of the location. 

Why I was here // My bf picked this place out for a mid-weeknight dinner around 6pm. He's a huge fan of philly cheesesteaks, grease, and all things bacon. 

Location // street parking was easy to find on a weeknight. I didn't really like the area that it was located, didn't feel as safe or pleasant to sit inside or outside the cafe. I will definitely be doing takeout for next time. 

Service // very friendly staff! 

Food // The V Cheese Steak // super delicious and total comfort food. Soft french bread, a foot in length, filled with juicy beef, cheese, and bacon (bit heavy on the bacon in my opinion), onions, pepper (I did a mix of sweet and spicy), and topped with avocado. 
Absolute taste explosion! Super filling and I was so satisfied. 

Overall // I really enjoyed their sandwich! I would come back for another but I can't eat this too often as I felt pretty sluggish afterward.
author: Emily T.

description:
I think it's amusing that I ended my first and last review of this long-standing place with: "I will have to go there sometime..." since I wrote that over 11 years ago. Back then, I took advantage of their free delivery and got them to bring me their big hoagies to get my sandwich fix in on many a lazy evening after work. I can still be "sloth-like", but even though I live close by, I entered this semi-popular spot for the very first time last week on my way back from Rainbow Grocery. Looking for a little lunch with my fiddlehead ferns and dried mango in tow, I thought I'd give it a try in person.

I was somewhat surprised how small it was. Luckily there was only one customer in the place, so I decided to eat there. No longer digesting crusty Dutch rolls, I went with the $7.50 Fresh Salad and had them add Salmon for $4.50 (photo: http://bit.ly/2jOEwGI). The salad part was fine with an assortment of fresh ingredients (including unexpected avocado slices) on the plate, but it went south with the salmon which was inexplicably deep-fried like it was being prepped as fish 'n chips. Luckily the balsamic dressing was on the side, so I could dip with caution. Well, at least I made good on that long-ago commitment to come here. Can't call me a slacker now.

FOOD - 3 stars...deep-fried salmon?
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...like a small company lunch room
SERVICE - 3 stars...it was fast but they don't talk much
TOTAL - 3 stars...'V' doesn't stand for 'verklempt'
author: Ed U.

description: Delicious prawns. Perfect texture. Fresh. Hot and crispy. I smelled other orders as they walked past me. Wow. So good.
author: Naamah P.

description:
I was attending a music event in the area so I turned to yelp for food within walking distance that was also open a little later in the evening (9pm) and found the v cafe.
There is sit down dining and a nice atmosphere for groups of 2-4. I placed my order for the sellout and the fries before arriving in the area so I didn't miss my event. I used the coupon that was available at the time and got a free can soda for exceeding a certain price amount. The sandwich had a wide range of fresh toppings with melt in your mouth deliciousness! It was large too so if filled me up to the point where I regretted the fries but still ate as much as I could with some ranch drizzled on the fries and sandwich for even more food amazingness. I was visiting from Los Angeles and this is by far my favorite spot in the bay so far for food!
author: Nicolas J.

description:
Eat24 order and delivery was smooth and pleasant. On time arrival and confirmation call prior, very organized.  

I am not a fan of sandwiches in general, but their grilled cheese is killer. It's made with large slabs of sour dough bread, pressed so the cheese oozes out the sides, and is presented well in the box with a side of garlic waffle fries. 

Cheese steak sammies are absolutely huge and can definitely be shared or eaten for a couple meals.

Garlic waffle fries are definitely a crowd pleaser, and they come with sides of ranch dressing and ketchup, which pleases just about everyone.

With our delivery order, we were given a free side of zucchini sticks and ranch dressing, and two cans of Coke. Very generous business. 

Pro-tip: dining in gets you 10% cash back as this is a cash back business.
author: Alison A.

description:
Friendly staff....

Cheesesteaks - quality meat and fresh topping that balances the flavor. Minus point because the portions looks big, however it's mainly because the the bread was larger than the topping ratio.

Bread was nicely toasted,m. Suggest either add a little more meat and toppings then it would be better.  Or simply replace it with a different kind of bread.

Delicious medium size steak fries, ...yum... nice portions... definitely will fill you up...
author: tommy c.

description: If you are in the mood for cheesesteak, this is your place. I'm no expert but the meat, bread, and cheese are all good. Make sure you pour some of Frank's Hot Sauce on it. I like to mix mine up with some ketchup and mustard as well. Anyhow, they've got plenty of other options as well so if I'm in the area, I'll be back.
author: Vinayak P.

description:
Burger and steak salad are very good. They have great delivery options if you're like me and cannot find the time to get out of the office. I typically order the cheese burger with fries. If you like the taste of home made grilled burger, this is the place. 

The service here is great as well. They are very accommodating.
author: Marfel L.

description:
3.5 STARS

We all have that one person at work that we wish had a mute button. You know that one person that says, they have a "quick" question when you have a deadline to meet which then turns into a 45 minute monologue about their ingrown toe nail or how their breakfast burrito gave them the Hershey squirts this morning. 

Yah, so yesterday was one of those days.

After trying my best to nod and smile for 30 minutes, I had enough and politely tried to excuse myself.

"Sorry, but I have to use the restroom."
"Oh, I'll walk with you."

"Oh no, it's ok, I have to meet my friends for lunch right afterwards."

And, these were my "friends" yesterday...like horny teenagers, they couldn't keep their hands (or their fins) off each other: http://bit.ly/2gFoTh0. I was like the third wheel watching them make out for the entire time I was at V Café and from the looks of it, it seems like this is a common occurrence. How cute.

I've only visited V Café inebriated after a Thursday night at Holy Cow (next door). It's been years and it's a bit of a blur but I remember the food being quite good. 

Ok, let's put this to the test...sober.

V Cafe's menu is filled with your typical drunchies: fries, waffle fries, chili cheese fries, mozzarella sticks, buffalo wings, grilled cheese, fried chicken, fish & chips, burgers, and foot long cheese steak sandwiches. Everything is under $13. $10 minimum for CCs. There's only a handful of tables and there's even dog-friendly outdoor seating. Though...I wouldn't want to sit outside. 

I ordered the Half Cheese Steak Combo with salad (or fries), and choice of drink (includes bottled water) for $10.95. I added mushrooms and extra cheese for $2. 

The staff is cold but they're efficient which is understandable given this is more of a late night drunchies haven. My order was ready in 5 minutes: http://bit.ly/2gSrqJh. 

The hoagie roll was nicely toasted inside and out and was filled with a scalding hot mixture of thinly sliced steak, sautéed mushrooms & onions, and lots of melty, stretchy cheese. It hit the spot since it was my first meal of the day but the flavor was off. I asked for hot peppers but this apparently translates to Huy Fong Garlic Chili Sauce here so it tasted a bit Asian to me (the cooks are Asian). The cashier didn't ask what cheese I wanted and gave me provolone by default so make sure to request a certain cheese if you want it. A half of a cheese steak is plenty but if you're going for value, then it's worth forgoing the combo and getting a whole cheese steak for $11 and save the leftovers for another meal. 

The salad was fresh and topped with sliced ripen roma tomatoes, crisp cucumbers, carrots, and garbanzo beans so no complaints there. 

I read a lot of negative reviews for delivery. I don't understand why people order fries (or anything fried) for delivery when it's a given that it's going to arrive soggy from condensation in the box. But, hey...I've ordered $150 worth of food service at a hotel before and passed out before eating it so I'm sure they had their reasons. 

Overall, my meal at V Café was decent but I prefer Buster's Cheese Steaks in North Beach. If I ate my meal inebriated (like I did years ago here), I wouldn't care about the off flavor from the Asian chili sauce but I hung up my dancing shoes years ago and traded it in for granny shoes. Comfort for the win!
author: Cherylynn N.

description: They serve food late which is a blessing since they are right by my place. The tuna melt and fries combo I bought was great. Even greater cause I didn't even eat it till the next morning after and still thoroughly enjoyed it.
author: Cynthia G.

description: So, I used UBEREATS to order from here and it was a disaster. Part A - First of all, my original order was cancelled without notifying me. So after it was not delivered by the promised time, I checked the site and it was cancelled. SO, I reordered it cuz, I really like their sandwiches. Part B - When the sandwich gets here, it is a steak sandwich. I wanted the chicken philly cheese sandwich.  I do not eat beef!! :-(  The french fries were yummy though. :-)  It will be a while before I go back to V Cafe. :-(
author: Annie W.

description:
What a pleasant surprise this place was!

Just before our concert began, my hubby and I decided to come here after seeing the overall Yelp reviews were good. However, my expectations were not high and I just love it when I am proven wrong. Truly, the food was better than I thought it would be.

PROS:
- The Fresh Salad was delicious! The crispy chicken I added to it was really tasty; it has a salty taste but I liked it!
- I love how they actually have greens in the salad, not that iceberg no-nutrition stuff. 
- Our food came out quick which was perfect because we were hurrying to get to our concert. AND, the quality wasn't compromised.
- The garlic fries that came with my hubby's sandwich was full of garlic flavor which I LOVE!

CONS:
- It was chilly outside and they left the doors open so it was chilly inside.
- There is a $10 minimum charge if using a credit card. If the amount is less than $10, your card will get charged an additional .50 cents (not a lot, but still).

Regardless of the CONS, I'd still come back here because the food it YUM!
author: Loreto D.

description:
Holy jump up and sit down, the food was excellent! By far, my favorite place in the city now. I rarely find myself satisfied with anything I order through Eat24. I am one tough customer, I guess but this place, this place is awesome.

Vcafe, Please don't ever change! This city needs more places like yours (again)!
author: Jackie K.

description: The lazy ass Caesar's Salad they made for me looked like something I regretted ordering until I forked up a few bites is when I realized how it didn't turn out so bad after all. I really don't want to 5 star this restaurant yet but ultimately I can't hate on my order or the location as the only reason I went in there in the first place was to ditch some skank I met at a dive bar down the street from the V Cafe and as we were getting ready to leave the bar she went back in to fetch her jacket so I decided to just walk away, turn the street corner, and VOILA, V Cafe.
author: Nacho A.

description: Loving this spot!!!  Stopped by before holy cow opened and wow!  The chicken finger is amazing and my friend had the grilled cheese which looked amazing!  The taste and service is phenomenal!
author: Tasha D.

description: Ordered for delivery. Food was early and very good.  The chicken Ceasar salad was huge and smothered in dressing - wild recommend getting dressing on the side. The cheese steak sandwich was delicious.
author: Christina F.

description:
Ordered food for delivery through Eat 24. Wait time was normal about an hour. I ordered the bacon cheese burger with garlic fries, my co-worker ordered the mushroom Philly with fries. 

My burger was very good. Big burger with all the fixings on the side. the burger was hot. my french fries were cold but I can't expect them to stay hot during transit so no harm. I really enjoyed the burger at any rate. I would order here again for a burger, but next time i would pass on ordering fries.
author: Kat D.

description:
I can't decide what's more shameful: the fact that the first time I was here I was so drunk that I can't even remember what the food tasted like, or this last time when I sober-ordered $20 worth of delivery from here even though I live only 2 blocks away (it wasn't even a rainy day). Hmm, hard to say........  

Anyway, I just know that I inhaled the food both times. And this has become one of our go-to late night drunchie spots that doubles as our neighborhood go-to when we're feeling lazy and fat. Overall, 3.5 stars. Rounding up. 

The Eat24 delivery arrived faster than expected... huge ups for that. Each order also comes with a free soda (add the coupon when you're ordering!), and I thought it was very nice that they called to confirm what soda we wanted.

The Sellout is my go-to order, and I get it with both hot peppers and sweet peppers. It comes smothered with cheese, mushrooms, and onions over meat - which makes the bread a little soggy, but as to be expected with delivery, but I'm still a happy camper. I can only ever manage to eat half of the beastly thing, and always save the other half for later. Just pop that sucker in the toaster oven and Bam! relive last night's drunchie glory!
author: Ashley S.

description: Had a great Tuna salad! Huge portion and a healthy amount of avocado. I got fries but they were pretty under-cooked.
author: Lizzy G.

description:
1. Menu above the cashier is current
2. Menu printed out is charged extra (makes no sense)

Okay y'all! Rainy night and need something cheap. This place is NOT! 

We orders 
1. bay shrimp Caesar salad + chicken 
2. 3 French fries
3. 1 Hawaii burger
4. I chicken steak hogie


How in the HELL does all of this equal out to $50!?
Every little this, every little that was an EXTRA CHARGE! Wtf! 

Hoagie was soggy
Fries were cold
Salad was okay
Burger wasn't even cooked well

Ugh! To save you money and your time

Skip this place!
author: Angelina B.

description:
Great,quick and good. I have been going here since they opened. They also deliver; )
Fish and chips, cheese steaks,onion rings to shrimp salads..
author: Marlon P.

description: I just had a cheeseburger and fries here and they were delicious. I asked for grilled onions which I recommend. It was $10 and it was worth it... A third of a pound burger with all the condiments, pickles tomato lettuce, everything fresh and delicious. Fast service very professional clean place good place to stop.
author: David P.

description:
I don't know how biased this review is, because I've never been here sober. With that said, V Cafe is great after a night out when you're not sober.

Their cheesesteaks: It might seem a little pricey for a sandwich, but keep in mind that it's a 12" roll so the portion size is huge. Both the sweet and hot peppers are great, but definitely go with hot if you enjoy and can handle spice. My one and only gripe about V Cafe is that the bread and cheesesteak filling ratio is a little off. Some bites seem like mostly bread, so there have been a few times when I finish the cheesesteak with a fork and leave some of the bread behind. If they put a little more filling, this review would probably be 5 stars.

The garlic waffle fries are a must for anyone who loves garlic. Seriously, they don't skimp on it. It's one of those foods that makes your breath stink even after brushing your teeth. Which is absolutely worth it, unless maybe you have a date first thing in the morning after a night of drinking (but why would you do that to yourself in the first place). The fries themselves are always served freshly fried and piping hot. 

Will definitely be back for more late night drunchies.
author: Sara L.

description: Very good food and affordable pricing - something that is becoming a rarity in the area. The menu is big and the serving size doesn't make you question whether or not you just got ripped off. Great lunch spot.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
AMAZING FOOD!

I have ordered 2 times (different food) through eat24 and both times have been equally Good. 
The size of the sandwiches are good (you can eat half and be full) and the taste is also amazing. 
It is not in the cheap range BUT it is also not that expensive. 
If you order delivery, DO NOT complain about your fries being soggy or food cold because it will happen regardless!! 
I will most definitely keep ordering from here.
author: Kryssia C.

description: To be honest I'm with everyone saying there fake reviews. What's true is there way over priced and sub par in the taste...never going there again
author: Kaylan K.

description: This the best place ,, staff are super nice . Thank you guys for delicious food and yummy food.. will come back again ....
author: John L.

description: Very nice find. Loved that they had a vegetarian option and was even able to get a salad instead of fries.
author: Lolita M.

description:
The good: Fast, easy pickup, good club sandwiches.
The bad: No one should have to eat their fries with Hunts Ketchup
author: Andrew P.

description: These must be fake reviews... Paid 20 bucks for a hoagie and onion rings, and it was nearly inedible. This place is outrageously expensive for poor quality food. Avoid at all cost. Eat your arm instead.
author: Alec B.

description:
I ordered V Cafe through Eat24.

I was scrolling through the website to find a restaurant and I thought we could try out V Cafe for delivery. The delivery time was normal which took almost an hour (as expected).

The fries were soggy because it was in the box with the cheeseburger bacon that I ordered. The burger was all right and thought it was both filling.
author: Aj C.

description:
The place looks nondescript but looks can be deceiving.  They are a legitimate sandwich outfit that does cheese steaks and your deli sandwich variety.  Large menu to choose from.  Everyone seems to know the staff and the staff is very friendly and very generous to someone, like me, who plops down for a long time to get some work done.  Very cool about using the bathroom even when all I had was a diet coke.

They are also open till 2 AM on weekends for your late-night chow-down.
author: Khash C.

description:
Ate: 2 cheesesteaks on 2 separate occasions.

Credit to the quality of the bread, and they weren't shy about filling the bread with meat but the quality was pretty poor and they oddly tasted of garlic. I saw them shake some kind of seasoning over the meat while cooking, perhaps that included garlic salt. 

Definitely hits the spot after some brewski's down the road at Buzzworks but the taste does not compare to a proper Philly - even though they do 'got the Wiz' on hand!
author: David J.

description: Not the best Philly I've ever had BUT damn close!  The service really takes it to 4 stars.  Great service and I love the endless fountain drinks.  Small place but we found seats quick.  I gotta make a visit after the bars next time.
author: Don A.

description: Tasty steak sandwiches with light cheese. Def not Philly style cheese steak sandwiches but definitely good. Ingredients were fresh with great service.
author: L T.

description:
Yes. Just yes.
 Used Grubhub.com to order my son and I a cheese steak sando and was pleasantly surprised by what was delivered. The delivery guy was very friendly and delivery was sooner than estimated. I will definitely be ordering from here again
author: Louisa T.

description:
Been here a few times. Always had the cheese burgers...try Folsom, or the 49r and if you can handle messy then the holy cow....all of them are amazing. Truly juicy, with loads of aftertaste and the fries are crazy good too. Fast, efficient and tasty. If you want ambience, it's not for you. But me, I want food.

They have other sandwiches too, which are kind of a favorite for few from what I have seen, can't vouch.
author: Himadri Shekhar K.

description: First time coming here. Food is great. I got a grilled cheese and fries, waffles fries are amazing. And boyfriend got a cheese steak sandwich, it was so good. Those don't come with fries though.. but the size is worth the cost. Great food, clean eating area, the building itself is a little small but cozy. Overall happy.
author: Jessica C.

description: Amassing?  How did I not know about this place?  The food is out of this world (I recommend the cheese steak with mushrooms and bacon) and is reasonably priced.  If you're in the neighborhood this is a must.
author: Tanner O.

description:
The food here was shockingly bad considering the number of positive reviews 

I had a salmon burger that tasted more like a wet cardboard box. That really says it all about this place, 10/10 would rather eat a turd
author: Jake R.

description: I love this place. They are super nice and accommodating! My favorite dish is the Fried Fish Sandwich! SOOO GOOD! Generous portions and instead of their delicious fries, I sometimes get the Fried Zucchini sticks!!! To die for! You gotta try this place.
author: Terri C.

description: Ordered a cheese steak and fries. The sandwich had ground burger meat and was more of a hoagie than a cheese steak. I was happy with what I ordered but it was pretty greasy and I needed a nap after I ate. Probably would not order from here again during the work day so that I do not sleep at my desk.
author: Max W.

description: We ordered team lunch on doordashers. I ordered the Salmon Caesar Salad with Avocado. It was good. Very filling. We also had the crinkle cut garlic fries which were fresh and tasty. We would definitely order from here again. The rest of the team ordered the cheese steak and po boy sandwiches!
author: Kam H.

description: This place has wonderful mozzarella sticks. I am a sucker for ordering when I see them on menus and most of the time, I'll take a bite or two and then push the plate away before grimacing. Not these, they are worth every bite!
author: Roger G.

description: I've been going here for 2 years now and it just occurred to me that I haven't yelped for this little gem in the wall.  Another solid lunch joint that is tasty, reasonably priced, and quick.   You can't go wrong with the chicken pesto sandwich, any of the cheese steaks, or salads.  There's an awesome lunch special that includes a 7 inch cheese steak, garlic fries, and a fountain drink for $10; that's a bargain!  Warning: if you're going to have the garlic fries, you will need a piece of gum (or 2) afterwards.
author: Jen M.

description: Ehh.  Not bad but not great either. Cheese steak was a little on the dry side.  Can't beat the specials though... 6 in cheesteak with fries and a drink for around $11.
author: Jami J.

description:
Not sure how this place got 4 stars. I've ordered from here 3 times too see if I'm just not ordering the right things. I've tried 3 of their salads, my husband has ordered different types of meals, mostly their cheesesteaks, and we've tried the criss cut fries too. The food here is consistently underwhelming, but maybe it's cause I always order for delivery too.

Perhaps they are known for their cheesesteaks but I don't often eat those kinds of unhealthy foods. My husband does and he wasn't gushing about it though. 

In my experience, the salads area definitely average. Nothing to rave about at all. I actually don't like their sliced chicken and I do love getting extra protein in my salads. I could barely touch a quarter of the salad the other day. My husband said his order was ok as well and offered me his criss cut fries. Honestly, the cross cut fries at Burger King are way better and more crispy than here. This place is not bad, it's just not good either.

At least I can say I've tried this place enough times and that I won't be ordering from here again. I've spent around $30 each time here and it's simply not worth it.
author: Lucky N.

description: Solid!   Half a cheesesteak, salad and iced tea for about $13.50.  Cheesesteak was plenty big (glad I ordered only a half) and very tasty.  Salad was good too.
author: Arnold T.

description: Food is delicious, heathy and delivered quickly!! Definitely a great choice for rainy days! Ordered salmon salad, popcorn shrimp, crispy chicken salad, chicken philly cheese steak... .
author: Sophanarath P.

description:
Ordered a cheesesteak here via DoorDasha and was not disappointed! They actually followed the special instructions I wrote for half mushroom and half plain (I was sharing with a friend, which is totally doable because it was huge). I dare say it was better that Phat Philly's in the Mission that we tried previously when we were craving cheesesteaks. 

We also ordered a fried zucchini instead of fries which were ok. They weren't soggy and I wouldn't blame them for that since I had it delivered to me at work. They were just plain and needed more seasoning. 

I'd definitely order from them again. They were great, I just need to order fries next time!
author: Leina K.

description: I've been here on three occasions and each time I have been satisfied. The service is speedy (I've never had to wait more than 5 minutes) and the staff are very kind and helpful. The burgers here are amazing; I really enjoyed them! The cheesesteaks are equally enjoyable. My favourite is definitely the Bacon CheeseSteak.
author: James A.

description:
I feel so bad! I meant to leave a tip in cash but my front desk security grabbed my order because I was in a meeting! I am so sorry to whoever handled my order today and did not get tipped!!!!

I spent $20 on my delivery order consisting of a cheesesteak with extra cheese, mushrooms, onions and sweet peppers and an order of Popcorn shrimp. I got a free soda with it, which I typically dont drink soda but figured heck, why not since its free. The popcorn shrimp were bomb! The cheesesteak was good, although it didnt seem to have extra swiss on it (considering it was an extra $1.50 for swiss i thought it would be semi-drowned). There werent enough sweet peppers in my opinion either, but there were alot of mushrooms and onions and the meat was delicious. The sandwich itself was HUGE and well worth 11.50 in my opinion. I really enjoyed my lunch today. 

I work nearby in the mission and did not want to go out in the rain to get lunch. The delivery was very convenient and they were impressively quick. I did not get a chance to interact with any of the staff since I ordered online, but the food was great and quick. Again, sorry for not tipping!!!!!!
author: Courtney T.

description: Super fast service to a great cheesesteak staff is super friendly and had a great conversation about the venue we are attending tonight come check out their nice decor and killer playlist of 80s music most definitely will be returning to this place.
author: Joseph S.

description: It was a dark and stormy night... and we sure the heck did not wanna go out in this storm... we ordered thru the yelp app for delivery and our order arrived quick and hot. I ordered a mushroom philly, which a half was more than enough. It was yummy! The fam ordered 1/3  pound cheeseburgers which came with fries. Can't complain, everything came out good. We will be placing orders from here again in the future!!
author: Christie M.

description: One of the worst dining experiences i've had in san francisco. My burger and fries were cold and my friend's turkey sandwich was falling apart. When I brought it to the attention of management they gave me the equivalent of "tough shit"...definitely will not be coming back here
author: James B.

description:
V Cafe is a really small kitchen with about a dozen tables for sitdown

menu: po boys, sammies, salads, philly cheesteaks, grilled cheese, hot dogs, hamburgers, grinders, hoagies, fish & chips, steak sammies, etc.

eats: grilled cheese on sourdough w/ fries(5.95)
-"waffles fries" needed more frying, a little mushy
-huge sammie, lots of cheese.

take outs:
-good value
-ready in minutes
-cooked to order, courteous service.
3.5 stars
author: Victor G.

description: Great when you are looking for a hamburger, philly cheese steak or even just a sandwich. Get the Waffle/Criss Cut Fries...amazing! Great lunch spot in Soma.
author: Julia R.

description:
This review is only for the delivery:

Food did taste good, however by the time it arrived, it was not warm at all and was not packed well at all. We had to reheat everything, Might not use them again.
author: Hamda A.

description: Huge selection and everything I've tried is great.  Also they deliver so you can shove your fat face with delicious cheese fries without needing to leave the comfort of your recliner.  When I'm in the area I make sure I get a trip in to V and I am considering moving closer for the sole purpose of their pizza cheese steak
author: Dom J.

description:
Delish!!
I love their chicken salad. Just tried their garlic fries and those were nice, too! Fresh, quick, tasty. Always clean, and staff is always sweet.
author: Evan Q.

description: The po boy is completely AWFUL!!! The garlic fries were over cooked. Never again!!! Dont be fooled cause it does smell good!!!
author: Charles T.

description: Good food,great service, and a varied menu. I have eaten there many times and am almost never let down. The Philly cheese steak sandwich is a good bet,and the burgers are also good. My issue is the club salmon sandwich, I had to search for the salmon, very thin and very scarce. A lot of bread,it should be called a bread sandwich with lettuce and salmon,emphasis bread:Three slices of bread,with the third slice in the middle to make up for the clear lack of Salmon. The meal is $9.95 with fries, so it does not break the bank,but I would readily pay $14.95 and get some salmon for real.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I came here for lunch today with a coworker. I ordered the feta salad with salmon, and she ordered the feta salad with tuna and a side of french fries. I was expecting a piece of grilled salmon, however the salmon is fried tempura style.  Also, the portions are huge! We had enough leftovers to last another meal or so. :) The prices are decent, especially considering it is made to order and the service is fast.

Fun fact: they participate in the FiveStars loyalty program. I may actually sign up especially since this is just around the corner from where I work. 

Definitely will be coming back .
author: Tracy C.

description:
I love V Cafe!! We order our lunches from there. I always ask fresh jalapeño inside Cesar Salad and they never forget to put it in. Delivery is very fast! Also I like free can of soda or two :) I wish one day they will do Kale Cesar Salad with Fresh - or Grilled jalapeños  

Also their club sandwich is our routine :) Thank You V-Cafe !
author: asli c.

description:
While on a work trip, we decided to order lunch from a given notebook of different menus.

I went light for lunch and got a Steak Caesar Salad.  Given that we ordered and it had to be picked up, the steak probably cooled down.  Nonetheless, the steak had flavor to it.  Good flavor.  The salad was whatever.

The 12-inch cheesesteak looked good.  But a gut bomb is what it looked like.  I wanted to save room for dinner later on too.
author: Sedine S.

description:
Great steak and cheese and chicken parmesan. Fries are great, but garlic fries did not seem to be mixed well, clumps of minced garlic on random fries, didn't taste great.

Burgers are nice also.
author: Tim B.

description: V Cafe is the greatest. Yummy food, friendly staff, and a fun and weird collection of San Francisco photos on the walls. Five stars!
author: Nick C.

description: Food is great (usually) but delivery can really be hit or miss, a couple of times a delivery not that far away have taken over an hour (tonight was 1 hour 15 minutes and was cold)
author: Jason L.

description:
OK, so maybe the mystique was lost on me because I didn't go in and experience the great service everyone has raved about and I wish I did. Sadly, I work nearby and had been in the office since 7am, up since 4:30 with no food. I was so hungry with no chance for a real lunch break in sight so I decided to yelp nearby places that delivered. V cafe popped up, and I read the reviews and decided to go for it.

I ordered fried zucchini, and a mushroom Philly cheese with extra hot peppers and cheese. I was excited by the reviews and was hoping for the best, but as hungry as I was it would have been hard to disappoint....


I'll say this. The delivery was super quick, I received my food in about 20-25 minutes and it was hot and fresh. And they followed my order instructions perfectly.

 I ate the zucchini first and they were not good at all. Now, I'm not sure if everyone is as particular as I am about their zucchini but this was breaded, then fried. They reminded me of mozzarella sticks from a chain restaurant. Same size, same beading, limp. If you've ever had zucchini from Carl's Jr, then this is the same exact thing, just different shape. I'm not a fan. I will not be ordering that again, and probably won't have a taste for fried zucchini for a while after that.

The Philly was on the better side of OK. It was good steak, and although I asked for extra cheese it wasn't quite extra cheesy. The thing that makes a Philly amazing to me is when the onions, peppers, steak and cheese all kinda become one amazing mix of goodness. That didn't happen with this sandwich. While it was definitely huge, and hot which I appreciated. It just didn't meet Philly steak standard of excellence. It wasn't bad, it just want VERY good.

I wish I had better things to say, but I'd rather be honest. I'm not a picky eater and I'm also not that yelper who tears everything to pieces, but these items just didn't do it for me. I'd much rather eat at the cheesesteak shop in the east bay.
author: Monique C.

description: As someone from Philly, it was surprising how good the cheesesteak was.  Way better than most you can find on the east coast.  Waffle fries were also great!
author: Dela P.

description: My roommates and I ordered from here to try something new since I'm new to SF and it hit the spot! The sandwiches are huge! Thanks for becoming one of my favorites!
author: Kali S.

description:
V Café is a perfect little spot if you need to grab a quick bite for lunch during your work day. I haven't eaten in the actual restaurant in just about two years, but you can order online and pick the food up within 15 minutes, which is great for me because the patrons there largely consist of ogling men, so I'm always happy to be in and out. But the staff there could not be nicer. They're always hustling about, trying to get the food out as quickly as possible, but they're always smiling and they know my name, even though I'm only ever in the restaurant for 90 seconds tops.

I really like the food and you're definitely getting a substantial amount of it for the price that you pay. You won't be getting any late afternoon hunger pains if you have a V Café burger for lunch. Speaking of, their burgers are really juicy and tasty, the club is big with plenty of turkey stuffed inside, and the salads are so big that I can never finish a whole one (can't finish a whole salad!?!?! It probably seems like that sentence doesn't make any sense, but trust me, it does.) One thing that I don't love about the food is that I never know what my french fry situation is gonna be. They're regular fries are great. Love 'em, no complaints. But sometimes they give me waffle fries and I just want to break down and cry. Ugh, waffle fries. This isn't a carnival and I'm not five years old. NO WAFFLE FRIES, PLEASE!!!

I should clarify something about the food: while I enjoy it for a work lunch every so often, this is not gourmet food we're talking about here. Don't go get a burger and then complain that Super Duper or Double Decker is waaaaay better and you can't believe how that stupid Stephenie girl on Yelp ACTUALLY likes the burgers. Don't be a snob and you'll enjoy the food just fine.
author: Stephenie S.

description: Loveeeeeeeeeee the cheese steaks!!!! In heaventhey're pretty quick about taking my order and serving my order to me..which I appreciate bc I come in there hungryyyyyy!!! It's a small chill place..like a mama and pop place which I love. Its homeythe sizes of those sandwiches are hugeeeee (that's what she said) lol so I usually can only handle half...a full size depending how hungry you are you can either split it or you'll be full the entire day after devouring that thang...yum yum yummm!! Just talking about it is making me hungryyy!
author: Stefany L.

description:
Another inebriated spot to go to after the local bars! LOL 
V cafe is located on Folsom and right next door to Holy Cow and Wish bar, so its a perfect place to eat drunk food! HAHAH I know everyone knows what I am talking about. Last night my friends mentioned they wanted to go eat there, after a couple of drinks. I thought to myself ohh okay, kind of disappointed because I wanted to eat at Naan n Curry. I never would have considered this spot anyways because I thought their cheese steak's were alright, nothing special about it. Maybe its because I don't eat these type of sandwiches often.

Any who, the service was fast for 10 people, and the sandwiches were huge!!! I ordered a Chicken teriyaki sandwich and didn't bother to finish it all. I ended up giving the rest to one of the guys. The food was okay, I was not impressed.
author: Kathy V.

description:
Of course the boy&I would end up here before a rave, completely starving, then get so full that we practically throw up during the event. Of course.

This is a nice hole in the wall restaurant that's affordable compared to everything else that's in the area. Okay, the service is really nice (the lady was really friendly&helpful with all my questions)&there is a lot of different things on the menu. The place is cute with all its different SF themed decor. I got the meatball sandwich&my boyfriend got a big ass cheesesteak. The food was HUGE. Like the sandwiches were so super long&filling, I enjoyed my food a lot. This place is a really good place to grab a quick bite (they're really fast when it comes to making food) but as always, being that it is SF, parking is really difficult (especially being that it was a Friday nights).
author: Catherine B.

description:
A few Friday nights ago my boyfriend and I casually rolled a joint, smoked it on our roof, and then ventured out into SOMA in search of good eats.  We wandered into this place baked out of our minds and decided to get an egg sandwich. mmmm.  Who doesn't like breakfast for dinner?

What they brought out could of killed a small child. 

This was no ordinary egg sando, it was 12 inches of french bread, 4 eggs, and countless Kraft slices. Considering myself a sort of breakfast aficionado, if I had my whits about me, I would have to gone back there, smacked that little korean chef on his tootsie, and shown him how to really make an egg sammy.  However, I was high and found myself just staring into space.  So, I had to sit this one out. But my man grubbed it like an effing champ.

I then decided to go back and order a "lighter" dish and opted for the mozzarella sticks. Man, this place really knows about presentation! I got 5 sticks, spread out like a sun, in a blob of marinara sauce on the middle of a flimsy ass paper plate. 


And to tell you the truth... If i smoke that OG death again, I'll probably go back.
author: Nicole M.

description:
I work very close to here and have walked by numerous times, finally venturing in here recently. 

Positives (+):
(+) Friendly people who work there
(+) Awesome menu - wide variety of cheesesteaks, burgers, hot and cold sandwiches, and a few salad options too 
(+) Mushroom cheesesteak - super yummy
(+) BBQ cheesesteak - I didn't actually try this, my coworker did, but it looked and smelled fantastic 
(+) We got some free garlic fries, and they were good 

Negatives (-): 
(-) Compromise - it had great potential, sauteed mushrooms, onions, two of my favorite things. I was intrigued by the horseradish sauce too. However, there was SO much horeseradish sauce it was like a huge punch in the face, totally overwhelming the entire sandwich. I could only eat a few bites from it, sadly. 

Despite the compromise, this is a great place. I'm definitely coming again.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Such gooood salads! Honestly- so glad I found this place! Ordered from Eat 24 - which I love - coupon on the week end - on if u forget to add the coupon code during order - u can add later - they are so accommodating- the V Cafe has great Fresh Veg Salads, great French Fresh Bread, delicious dressing- this is going to be my next fav place to get a salad!
author: Andrrs B.

description: Ate here twice. I will go back. Great quality and very quick and fresh. Good selection on the menu too.
author: Zack K.

description:
Should you have time to kill before a show at DNA lounge or Slim's I highly recommend checking out the very underrated V Café. 

I tried a meh burger here one time, but after last night it goes to show you really have the order the right things off the menu. 

Enter the Compromise cheesesteak (no cheese) $8.95 sub chicken with mushrooms, onions, and horseradish. This sandwich was HUGE, tasty, and oh-so-spicy! (lady taking my order warned me. 12 inches of saucy, hearty, dining pleasure. Top of the bread roll disentegrated easily on one half of the sandwich, which wasn't really a bummer, just weird. The sandwich was ready in just a few minutes too!

I've found my go to spot before enjoying the sounds of Dillinger Escape Plan, Retox and Trash Talk. 

Mmmmmm. Can't wait to go back!
author: Taj A.

description: As always, ordering the fried chicken meal made me satusfied. It's smells good, looks good , arrive ahead of time and all around just yummy!  Love ordering from here when I'm at work!
author: Bridget R.

description: Ive been here for many of years The Food is Awsome, the Philly cheesesteak broke da mouth....!!! The customer service is excellent.
author: Braddah Rick M.

description: I was visiting frisco and a friend recommended this place. I was impressed, Asian cooks, looked like owners, made a bombass Philly cheesesteak, this wasn't no ordinary hoggie. Something about it was just upright delicious! I got the Philly cheese steak with mushrooms. It had a nice slice kick that wasn't unbearable but spicy enough to want more. I want to go back and check it out next time I'm in SF. Give it a try!
author: S. L.

description: Great find. Keepin' it real with the Philly cheesesteak!!! Watch out for that horseradish sauce. It's got a bite!
author: Matt S.

description: Ordered two burgers with fries and mozzarella sticks. Decent burgers, definitely not the best in the city. But they get the job done. I ordered delivery and the food was brought to me very quickly. Overall it was a very pleasant experience.
author: Charlene S.

description: Let's just put it this way, I'm anything but a Philadelphia native, but I know what I am putting into my mouth. I do find most of the reviews up here to be reflective of the truth: Extremely friendly stuff, nice bang of a buck, and very fattening options overall. But the Philly Cheese Steak just feels way too excess - I specifically called to avoid pepper, onions and such, but it still stimulated more of my taste buds than I expected - and for a traditional food like this, it is definitely a turn-off. And fries are mediocre at best, but they aren't really the point anyways. Otherwise they get the job done, huge portion for a modest price, a free soda refill like any other hoagie spots, and the kind of small business vibe that you'll be glad to find in this increasingly gentrified neighborhood.
author: Wayne C.

description: Came in here to grab a bite while my SL65 ///AMG Black Prestige GT was in for service. Quicky, greasy, bite of all American food. 4/5 just because theres not a good place to wait inside.
author: AventadorDan B.

description: Grilled cheese had a strong taste of oil in the bread. Classic grilled cheese should be pan fried with butter. Fries we soggy.
author: Michael S.

description:
My lady friend and I were around the corner and in need of sustenance. I hopped on Yelp, of course, and offered her a selection of decently-rated places nearby. She chose V Cafe and I phoned in an order for burgers.

I had the mushroom cheeseburger with Swiss and she had a cheeseburger with garlic fries instead of regular. She enjoyed her burger and was very excited about her fries being 'so garlicky, mmmm', and I really enjoyed my burger, too. It was yummy and exceeded my expectations.

As if that weren't reason enough to eat here, the service was really friendly and they were so quick! It was a pleasant experience and the food was definitely better than standard diner fare.

I'm happy we tried this place and we both are looking forward to sampling other things on their menu.
author: W W.

description:
This was a pleasant surprise.

I had the Philly CheeseSteak and it was actually really good...it definitely had more flavor than most of the cheese steaks I had in Philly!  The meat was tender and seasoned very well.  They put on a good amount of cheese and it really made it a rich sandwich.  

The next time I want a very cheap meal and I'm in the area, I'd definitely stop by this place.  They have great and friendly customer service as well.
author: Ken G.

description:
(See pic)

More of 3.5 stars.

Great local Philly cheesteak joint that comes with fries and drinks as a combo. Good way to load up calories with cheese and beef.

Service was also fast.
author: T L.

description: Let's just say V Cafe was V fire. My friend Nina, who is a grilled cheese connoisseur to say the least, said and I quote "this is the best grilled cheese I have EVER had" v aggressive + v fun = v cafe!!
author: Kenny D.

description: Staff is awesome, and they're food rocks!  Love the place and the people.  What's more, they take FiveStars which gives me a free soda every few visits.  What's not to love?
author: Jay D.

description: We order from here on the Eat24 App.  The food is great and they always deliver with a smile.   The chicken cheese steak hoagie is the bomb!!!
author: Rhonnie R.

description: This place is amazing . No comparison and hands down! Love this place. I live in San Jose and will drive here to get a burger. This place is a diamond in the rough!
author: Shannan L.

description:
I stepped out of the front door at the shop on 8th street, dialed up V cafe, hadn't been in way too long.  "Chicken cheesesteak hoagie with spicy pepper?"  "Yes", I confirm to the nice asian sounding lady on the phone.  "Be ready in few minutes thank you".  Click...oh no, she never took my name!
  Oh i figure after i get there and wade thru a huge line of people at 1:30 on a Tuesday, Ill just re-order and wait.
  BUT NO, I get there and NOBODY is in line, I walk up to the counter, I see an Asian lady walking away from me and she looks back as she is grabbing a wet, warm, cheesy, masterpiece (yes I can tell thru the white paper it is wrapped in) off of the top of some kinda kitchen warming thingy snd says; "You call on the phone?"  "Yes" I confirm, "$10.89 please", she says...GLADLY!  A delicious, footlong chicken cheesesteak hoagie with all the good stuff tomatoes, lettuce, peppers(HOT)...Made in the time it takes me to walk a couple blocks...just the memory of it as I writing this review makes me boost it from 4 to 5.  Best lunch deal in SOMA with the exception of AK SUBS and PINKIES BAKERY...yes I also put a dollar in the jar...
THANK YOU VCAFE!
author: Tony B.

description:
Wandered into this place while heading from the mission down toward civic center. We were hungry and saw the word cheesesteak.

The boyfriend got the footlong cheesesteak, and I got the cheesesteak special which was 6 inch sandwich with garlic fries and a soda.

The cheesesteak was tasty. It's no cheesesteak shop cheesesteak, but still pretty darn good.  I added some hot sauce because I like my food spicy. That 6 inch sub had me filled up.

The fries?

Oh yeah, the fries. They weren't that great. Kinda cooked too much, some had tons of garlic but others didn't.

I'd definitely go back, but only if I HAPPEN to be in the area (which probably isn't likely). So in any case, I recommend it!
author: Vanessa F.

description: I'm not sure why there are so many positive reviews. I ordered delivery from this place (I live less than 2 miles away) and it took an hr and a half to get my meal. I basically got a extremely greasy philly cheese steak that was subpar in taste. One half of the entire cheese steak for really  soggy because of all the grease; it was like eating mush. The fries were stale as well. The only thing that was ok was my salad but it's pretty hard to mess that up. I read reviews saying this the most authentic philly cheese steak in SF; are you kidding me? The food was poorly prepared and it might have been more acceptable if they didn't rush it. Fyi: I did not finish my sandwich. Will never order from here again.
author: Divi D.

description:
Good Food Fo Sho but

                     Closded on Sundays 

- something good to know as I headed down there 
to realize they be closed.
author: Rew C.

description:
I really have to give kudos to this [seemingly family] that keeps this place open next to the bars [Holy Cow and Wishbone]. It's not easy dealing with my friends and the possy of 10 drunkies without kicking us out.

Anyways, I got myself a mushroom cheesesteak here for about 10 bucks. It's definitely larger than a footlong. However, I don't know if it's me or what, but I have yet to find a really really cheesesteak sandwich. I loved how they used a baguette instead but the flavoring was not up to par. The peppers weren't spicy [or spicy enough] either and I think they skimped a little on the filling since I feel like I'd just get a mouthful of bread. 

Their burgers look DELICIOUS and juicy though. Still, I got A+ service here. The lady at the counter was really nice and polite as are the boys in the kitchen. Maybe if I give Holy Cow a second shot, I'd do the same here :D
author: Mary C.

description: Showed up to meet some friends at Holy Cow only to find out that they didn't open until 9pm. We were a bit peckish so we stopped by V Cafe to grab a bite to eat. The food is not cheap (it was $24 for two of us) and my burger was pretty bad (it had craft cheese slices). If I know I am heading to that neighborhood I will make sure I have eaten ahead of time.
author: Casey S.

description: Had a great philly cheese steak! A little light on seating, but no other complaints. There's a TV on the wall, a fish aquarium near the back, and a good vantage point of the city life from inside. I feel very out of place in this city, but it was nice to find this little spot.
author: Justin B.

description: Flipping gross. Everything there is so greasy and at the same time has no flavor. The bread they serve the cheesesteak on falls apart the french fries are whatever and they serve it to you in this oblong shaped tray that makes it impossible to eat.  This place is in a huge waste of calories. Will not go back.
author: Mel M.

description:
So, I'm here like almost every day. There aren't a lot of good lunch options in this part of SoMa but I'll be damned if this isn't one of the best. Everything I've ever gotten here has been genuinely good quality, no cut corners or skimping ever, and I've been here probably close to a hundred times by now. Sure it's greasy as hell diner food, but it's delicious and served hot, fresh and blindingly quick. One of the most efficient, fast paced kitchens I've ever seen in my life. I will say that if you order a cheesesteak and expect a "real authentic Philly cheesesteak" then guess what, you're going to be disappointed. It's more like a "grilled steak sandwich on a toasted roll", but who cares, it's good. Their salads are really good too, if you want to minimize your intake of greasy fried deliciousness.

Also the service is friendly and like everything else, super quick and efficient. Your table will sometimes get bussed and cleaned up before you're even all the way out the door. This place literally has no downsides to it, except maybe the limited seating, but the place is a hole in the wall, so it is what it is. Whenever I have no idea what I want for lunch, I usually just end up coming here because I know I won't be disappointed. Keep it up V Cafe.

P.S. Not sure why it's called V Cafe, they don't even serve coffee here? Oh well.
author: Brendan R.

description:
This is a review of delivery from V Cafe.

Easy to order via http://eat24hours.com/

Delivery - The order was placed at  1:59 PM.    The order was delivered at 2:44 PM.  At 45 minutes, the delivery time was well within the estimate of 45 to 60 minutes.  While not super speedy, I do consider delivery within 45 minutes to be relatively fast.  There was a $1 delivery fee.  The delivery person was polite and professional.

Order Minimum - The order minimum is low ($14).

Cheese-steak Sandwich - This was a pretty good sandwich.  The roll was nice and soft.  The meat could have been a touch more tender and it could of been a bit cheesier.  But I enjoyed it.  It was also a pretty large sandwich.

http://tinyurl.com/3vg2wc5

Bacon Cheeseburger - This was a mediocre burger.   It was cooked past the ordered medium.  I would guess the patty had been frozen.  It did had that heavy denseness that usually only comes from a frozen patty.  It was edible but that was about it.

http://tinyurl.com/3fxowqy

Waffle Fries - These came with the burger and were very good.  

Packing  - The food was all neatly packed.

Pricing - The prices are inline with my expectations.  I received a free soda for ordering $20 worth of food.  This offset the delivery charge.

Soda 1 $1.35 Flavor: Coke Free !
Cheese steak Sandwich 1 $7.50 
Bacon Cheeseburger 1 $7.95
Soda 2 $1.35 Flavor: Sprite

Subtotal: $19.50
 Discount: $1.35
 Tax: $1.63
 Delivery Charge: $1.00
Total:   $20.78 

Overall - The quality was a mixed bag.  The philly was better than the burger.  The prices were decent.  I would not order from them again for  a philly or a burger though.  I can get better versions of either delivered.  I might check out some of their other menu items.  Because they do have some interesting options for delivery.  The prices were decent and delivery was relatively fast.
author: Mark D.

description:
Went there today before my shift and ordered a "half philly cheese steak sandwich". 
To my surprise I got a large free refillable fountain soda, garlic wedges and a hot juices Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich for under $9. 
When I returned the plate to be thrown away the owner asked me "what happened, you didn't like it". I told him NO I just couldn't finish all of it man.  
I'm glad I just got the half order, their servings are huge. I will need to go there again.
author: Shaun R.

description: Great diner food.  Love the cheesesteaks, fries and turkey subs.  Guilty pleasure food but darn delicious.  Love the fact that they also stuff napkins and ketchup in your takeout bags without asking.  This little touch never happens anymore.  Definitely recommend.
author: B K.

description:
good little cafe. Love the fact that they make everything to order. They are open late too, as I saw a sign that said open till 2am. Not sure if it's just weekends tho.

The cheesesteak was very good, very flavorful. They use a french roll, similar to a banh mi roll so if you are looking for a authentic philly amoroso roll, this isn't it. But it is still delicious all the same.

Definitely get the garlic fries. Just enough garlic for it to taste good but not be overwhelming. Crunchy on the outside and hot and fluffy on the inside.

The fried zucchini sticks are good too. so hot -i.e. burn your mouth hot!-so crunchy and so just the right late night snack to die for.
author: Dom L.

description:
Not the greatest restaurant.... The recipes are real messed up...flavors are off. I think its because its owned and operated by Asian people cooking American food. No offense... its kind of like an Italian family cooking Indian or thai food.  I got the cheese steak and onion rings. 

The cheesesteak: 1) I wish they had used real cheese instead of cheese wizz? 2) there was not enough meat and the piece of bread was huge... I had to throw away a piece of the bread that had no meat. 3) the type of meat was not thin sliced like a cheese steak should be. It was like Korean BBQ beef sirloin, not cheesesteak thin sliced brisket. I am comparing this cheesesteak to "cheesesteakshop"

The Onion Rings: taste like burger king onion rings, but cost $7. I dont know why they are called beer battered, nor do I know why they come with white tarter sauce.

Needless to say I wont be ordering from here again... unless I am very desperate, food truck food is much better.
author: Nick W.

description: The burgers were very tasty and I really enjoyed their unique french fries!
author: David L.

description: V Cafe is quickly becoming our go-to lunch spot. Large portions at reasonable prices. Everything I've ordered has been pretty damn tasty. Probably not good for my ass but my belly is satisfied.
author: Monique D.

description: Amazing late night spot. We came here with a group of friends after the bars and ordered about 10 different things off the menu and we were consistently impressed. I'd recommend their popcorn shrimp.
author: Amy Z.

description:
My friend lives in SOMA and said this place was pretty good. They seemed to have a lot of vegetarian options  for my friend and great meat options for me!

I had a philly cheesesteak and he had a grilled cheese with caesar salad. The food didn't take a long time and the people were really nice! Loved it.

Definitely will come back again :D
author: Ezequiel R.

description: One of my favorite in the neighborhood. The sandwiches are great especially the Philly cheesesteak. The lady who works there is very friendly and sweet. Check this place out!
author: Gary P.

description: Best Philly cheesesteak I had in a veryl ong time.  Love this place.  Friendly staff.  I recommand this place to anyone that is visiting San Francisco.  The food is awesome.   My fav was the mushroom cheesesteak and the compromise.
author: Eric M.

description:
I'm only giving 2 stars because their fries and onion rings were amazing... but everything else was a giant fail.

In my constant search for a decent American-style lunch spot near work, I tried V Cafe.

Prices are a bit steep - paid $8.95 for a bacon cheeseburger with a handful of fries - and the burger was your straight up frozen, not fresh patty.  The patty itself tasted like garbage.  The bacon was crispy but there was barely any bacon taste - just tasted like Chinese oil as another reviewer mentioned.  HOW CAN YOU NOT MAKE BACON TASTE GOOD?!?! :(  So, there went the "protein" part of my meal... big sadface.

On a plus - their fries were fantastic and managed to travel well, as were their onion rings.   My main issue was with the delivery guy.  He kept calling my cell phone asking for directions when I had included them in my GrubHub order.  I work in a very hard-to-miss building.  First time he called, he said he was at our door and when I went outside, he was nowhere to be found.  About 15 minutes later, I see a car outside the gate and as I go out to see if it was the guy, he drove off.  He called back, I asked if that was him, he said yes... and then another 15 minutes went by before I saw him again.  He called me several times during this time but every time I picked up to try and help him, he'd say "Hold on" and then would hang up.

So, yeah dealing with their incompetent delivery driver was not fun.  I'll stick to Holy Grill for my overpriced burgers - at least theirs taste good.
author: Elizabeth E.

description: Great little place. Tasty food and fast service! The meals are a great deal and you get a ton of food. We were in town for a training and this was a great find. Had the philly cheese steak with a side salad. Great portions and yummy food!
author: Stevee L.

description: Salad ingredients were the opposite of fresh. I expect better from an $11 salad in a place with a TV and that looks like a dump.
author: Manal D.

description: The best place you can eat an afford !! Delicious and satisfyingly great!! Will be going back!!!
author: Lourdes D.

description:
Where do you go for a bite to eat at 2am after stumbling out of Paradise Lounge???  V Cafe!!!

My friends wanted food, and we didn't want to go far.  As we walked down the street, we saw V Cafe.  We saw cheese steaks on the menu and decided to stay and fill our bellies.  My friend got the bacon cheese steak( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/hjHW0xXjfgXJ23GpCP0Cyw/l ) and I shared the mushroom cheese steak( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/hjHW0xXjfgXJ23GpCP0Cyw/l ).  The cheese steaks were huge!  I was pretty full after eating my half.  They load it with tons of meat and mushrooms.  Add a little hot sauce to give it some extra zing.

I'd give 3.5 stars for the food.  And they get an extra .5 for dealing with all the drunkos after hours.
author: Patra I.

description: I'm not inferring greatness, but the bacon cheese steak warms the soul, piled high with hyperbole.  I'm a foodie so I understand the jurisdiction of each kitchen.  Burgers, bacon, fries and anything teriyaki.  Teriyaki anything like you can adobo anything.  Eat well.  Leflaur Leflah Eshkoshka!
author: Aristotle S.

description:
{This review is based on delivery only} 

So my buddy and I have ordered from here twice the first time we ordered we had a 12" Philly cheese-stake with bacon and a order of there chilly cheese fries which were to die for. There's something about the waffle fries that taste better than the normal cut fries. The second time around we order of course the chilly cheeses fries and a 12" tuna with provolone. Now this was one of the best tuna sandwiches I have had in a long time there was something about the sauce or seasoning that made me want more after each bite. I have yet had a chance to go in to the cafe but definitely recommend you order something for lunch. *Hint* chilly cheese fries
author: Ivette K.

description:
Great place to stop by when hungry after HH at one of the nearby bars. Big 12" Philly Cheesesteaks - not quite the same as those I gobbled in the city of brotherly love - but this fits the bill. All sandwiches average about $7.95, mine had grilled onions, mushrooms, cheese and beef. It's not the kind of sandwich you can't put your mouth around. In fact it squishes down quite a bit, but if you add a side of steak fries and a drink (takes you up to about $10) you'll be set.

The mozzarella sticks and fried zucchini were ok too. You get a generous helping.

Owners are nice - they put up with a bunch of semi-drunk and hungry people really well. 

Clean bathroom - 1 stall - available for customers.
author: Cindy W.

description: This is where I go for lunch if I forget it at home. It is decent American food like burgers but there is a decent selection. Five stars for convenience because you can order online or by phone ahead of time but it usually takes ten or fifteen minutes if you just walk in. Food is good but not spectacular; however the staff is friendly. You can get a decent lunch for under $10.
author: Nathan M.

description:
V for Vendetta, I just might have one now.

Really not bad but just not that good.  Given the prices, portion and grease this place doesn't stand out in any way really.  My mushroom cheese steak was kinda meaty, kinda shroomy, slightly cheesy, mostly bready.

Just like what brought me in here, good if you want something quick and easy because you really don't have time for anything else.  Otherwise pass.
author: Steven R.

description:
Somehow I missed writing a review of this place over a year ago. Good thing I did because I hated it. 

I'm a lunch-goer here, unlike the midnight crowd...and I was looking for a new sandwich. Yet again I saw the awesome reviews and knew that I must have gone on an off day. 

I got the half philly cheese steak with sweet (aka bell) peppers (vs hot was the other option, not sure what hot was) with garlic fries and a soda for $7ish. Awesomely tasty. The garlic fries were some of the best I've had in the city, not too overkill on the garlic, but enough to leave me with bad breath :)

It was cold as the arctic in there though...I ate with my jacket on and my fries got cold in a heartbeat :(
author: Jennifer P.

description:
If it's 2:30am after leaving a mashup party and your friends have ditched you for an impromptu sleepover, then this is the place to get your threesome on with some cheese and some steak!  No it's not as good as in Philly, but yes it's tasty when you don't feel like second rate pizza or yet another taco stand.

Cheesesteak: The roll was more of a soft baguette than hoagie, but was still tolerable.  The steak bits were right on, cooked to a good doneness.  The cheese was generic cheez whiz (since when did cheez whiz become so expensive that you need to bootleg it?) so could have been better.  I enjoyed the non-traditional difference that the hot peppers were more of a ground paste since it gave a really good kick.
author: Adam B.

description: Went here for dinner last night and hot the house special C.  This consists of a half shrimp Po Boy, soda, and garlic fries.  We have had this before but I don't ever remember the size of a full.  The sandwhich was HUGE.  Thankgoodness my boyfriend and I ordered the same thing!  Imagine the size of  a full sandwhich! :)  Oh, AND the garlic fries are WAFFLE GARLIC FRIES!  LOVE!  We couldn't have been happier with choosing to eat here for dinner! :)
author: Sheena C.

description:
I was hungry for a good hamburger and was reluctant about having it delivered.
But I went ahead and ordered it via GrubHub. In less than 1/2 hour it was delivered.
I don't live that far from where they are located so that helped in that case. I ordered the Avocado Cheese Burger with Olives and it was very fresh and tasty. The french fries were still warm and crispy. Because of the minimum order, I also ordered a caesar salad to have later that day..so I got two meals in on shot.  A little pricey when added up but the convenience, great food and prompt service made it worth it.
I give it 5 stars for the ease and promptness...would prob. give it 4 for quality of food.
author: John l.

description: Love this place! I am a little odd about what I like on my sandwiches and they also follow through on the requests. We get delivery from them via grubhub frequently and food arrives fast and is always still warm. Also really appreciate the crunchy fries!
author: ipvcake i.

description:
V stands for voracious.

Or perhaps vigorous. That's how you'll consume their ridiculously large, ridiculously good turkey meatball sub. Massive meatballs. Oozing marina sauce. Packed into a roll. Cheese if you want it. Tomatoes, lettuce and pickles if you ask. Literally two outstanding sandwiches in one.

You could say each half was eaten vivaciously.
author: Jason B.

description:
Great spot semi hidden but if you frequent Holy Cow or the club right around the corner, you'll be pretty familiar with this place post clubbing/bar. A cafe it is not. When you think cafe, you think coffee, snacks, light foods... but no. This is full blown Philly Cheesesteaks and then some.

The place is a little small, but has table seating, and small bar type seating. A few tables, maybe enough to seat like 30 folks, i may be wrong though. Place feels clean. Not dirty. Upkept. Servcie was good, but you have to keep an ear out for your order because sometimes they call it out and you have to pick it up. Its changed a few times. From names, number, to order. Weird.

I've tried a few of their cheesesteaks but you can't go wrong with their Philly with everything on it... AND waffle fries. Garlic waffle fries. I wonder if they still have that... but that was realllly good. The footlong is big, and with everything on it, it looks majestic. The cheesesteak does lack a little flavor, but i really can't complain. It's still good. I love to tobasco it up for that extra kick. It's all on a soft steak bread. The fries are an excellent side as they compiment perfectly. So good. When you think cheesesteak, this is it.
author: Jay V.

description: Clean,  good food,  well priced, and friendly staff.  Vincent hooked me up with a grilled chicken sandwich on a nice Bun,  and a side salad that had more than just lettuce and tomatoes.  I highly recommend this little gem!
author: Cow H.

description:
Love V Cafe.  Nothing fancy but great prices and good food.  Doesn't matter what you order, your going to love it.  I like to order the BLT or Club and both come with delicious fries.  

Love V Cafe
author: C R.

description: The V - Bacon, Avocado, Mushrooms, Cheese, added Jalapenos. Wow. So good.
author: Zeke M.

description: This place should be avoided at all costs.  They have no business selling "Cheese Steaks".  This is a grease pit meant for people with no taste for good food.  They have some of the worst food in the area.  Anybody who returns here after trying it is crazy.  We are warning everyone to eat somewhere else!  If you want a crappy overpriced sandwich walk five blocks to Deli Board and waste your money.  This place is far worse and as overpriced as Deli Board.  If you want the Best Cheese Steak in the City, go to Divisadero and Sutter to The Cheese Steak Shop.  If you are about to eat here you should look in the mirror and slap yourself...Don't do it!!!  Go to a different place...
author: D.c.g G.

description:
"ouch, ouch, ouch" 
Four hungry and alcohol induced girls turn the corner with sad faces, not because their feet are in pain, but because their stomachs ache for sustenance and their late night crepe stand is cash only. 

Suddenly, an extraordinary aroma trails towards them and their noses begin to wiggle as they gravitate to V cafe. Open late, accepts credit card and as confirmed by the vato outside, the philly cheesesteaks are 'the bomb'. 

Were we hungry? Yes
Were we scared to walk away from his suggestion? Yes.
So, we ate. 

One order alone is huge and extremely reasonable in price. Every sandwhich was made fresh and piping hot off the press. We flooded our mouths with huge bites of cheesesteak and Frankies hot sauce, never allowing it to have one dull moment.

If you ever find yourself coming out of one of the many bars around here (Holy cow, Mist, etc) and hungry, you know where to go; they're open late on weekends!
author: Kelly S.

description:
I was working around this area and was going to gonto Teds Market for a pastrami sandwich but saw this joint V cafe. Hmmm...ok, bring the yelp reviews for this place. This joint is 4 stars. Ok, let me try it.

Read some reviews and somebody says their philly cheeseteak "is the bomb" Ordered their cheese steak with everything on it. 

Here's come the chees steak.  The sandwich is pretty big. It's like a footlong, they dont skimp on the meat BUT its lacking flavor. The cheese is like swiss, not enough onions, or peppers but they put pepper flakes (like for the pizza) to give some spice on the sandwich.

I think it's kinda bland and I was dissapointed with their philly cheese steak.

The staff are nice and they are open till 2 am.

Am i going back? hmmm, i will definitely go to Ted's intead to get some hot pastrami sandwich.
author: roderick s.

description: I've been going there for lunch since it's 1 block away from my job,  and I'm loving they're Teriyaki Salmon Burger and Garlic fries. Hits the spot every time I go.
author: Myra S.

description:
Add this to my "why I love greasy spoons" list. The first time I came here my heart melted over a steaming broiled chicken hoagie sandwich and the no-frills atmosphere (and not necessarily in that order: I hold a certain attraction for blunt, spartan diners in the same way people flock to Dr. Phil for tough love). And that literally steaming chicken smelled almost BETTER than it tasted - but it did also taste really good. So tender it melted in your mouth.

Next up was lunch a few months later: I opted for the chicken SALAD and the greens and size and chicken itself did not disappoint.

The only bummer is lack of coffee drinks (I really needed one on my 2nd visit), but this is well worthy of greasy spoon stature (recall, this is a very good thing).
author: Diane B.

description: I dropped in tonight and ordered a Cheese Steak Sandwich and Beer Battered Onion Rings.  I had no idea how huge these sandwiches are.  A foot long soft roll dripping with gooey, stringy melted cheese topped with a beef and onion mixture and peppers (your choice of hot or sweet).  Dripping with a combination of meat juices, grease and cheese the sandwich was awesome.  The rings were good too, but I couldn't finish my order because the sandwich left me stuffed.  Fast, efficient service on a somewhat busy Friday night, I'll definitely be back again.  A solid four stars!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
Some friends and I dined here at 11pm on a Saturday night on a whim, and we were pleasantly surprised. 

The cheesesteaks were huge, greasy, and pretty good for the price. We got our orders just a few minutes after ordering, and V Cafe is conveniently located by Butter, and other bars.
author: Andrea B.

description:
I came here on a windy day while getting my girls car looked at by The Smog Shop (best mechanics in the city btw), we were looking for something to eat anywhere we can find to get out of the crazy wind and this was the only place open.

Here's the thing...its a greasy spoon restaurant. the types of places you went with your grandpa when you were a kid or if you were lucky like me, with your grandpa and later in life with your landscaping buds in the wee hours of the morning..this was when white people were humble enough to actually DO manual labor....so yea...its a while ago.

I like greasy spoons...the food always has that homey kinda feel to it when you eat it and usually the place is setup with just enough decor that its almost like you are in someones basement or house.

V is that kinda place...V is a shithole in the middle of the city that doesn't care about its looks and serves up for the money...a decent greasy meal.

Don't come here if you want healthy, don't come here if you can't handle holes in the wall. Come here if you leave DNA lounge or Slims hell even Butter and are dying for a good cheesesteak (not a great one...just a good one) or a FAT ass hamburger that turns the bun pink from all its grease and juice.

It was a hearty meal in a shitty little hole. I'd eat here again late at night after a round of drinking with friends. The grease will stop my hangover from coming.
author: Dean M.

description:
Everything here is greasy.  Just look a the pix.  But you should have expected that.  

The bread for my sub didn't really do it for me.  Not gooey enough, rather burnt and hard actually.  The kind of bread that leaves a bad feeling against the roof of your mouth that won't go away for a while.  Quality of meat is kinda whatever.  

I'd go there again, simply cuz there's not much else to eat around.
author: Dong T.

description:
Yummy criss-cut fries
Yummier philly cheese steak subs with onions and bell-peppers.
Great, fast service.
Stays open late on weekends. Sometimes past 2am.
author: Andrew Z.

description:
This little place is a reflection of the neighborhood it resides in. It's a little run down, a little cramp but with a whole lot of character. 

I've eaten here a few times along with the automotive workers, the folks in khakis colored clothes and IDs hanging off their lanyards and the locals. What tasty and healthy helpings of food. The waffle cut garlic fries are the yummiest and the price for the amount of food can feed two people. I am a customer whenever I am in that neck of the woods.
author: lily l.

description: I want my $13 dollars back.  I will never ever ever order anything from this place again. I had the fried chicken with fries and a salad.  First I would like to know what planet did they find that chicken. I've never seen chicken pieces so tiny. There were 4 pieces of chicken.  The wing was the size of my thumb. The wing was the sized of my other thumb. Then there were the breast and thigh.  Which wasn't much bigger.  I've never had such flavorless bland chicken. How do you mess up fried chicken? They answered that question today. I make better chicken at home.  That brings me to the criss cross fries.   Are they suppose to be stale tasting and bland. Shouldn't they be crispy at least.  The only thing barely edible was the salad. Thank you for ruing my lunch V Cafe.  The nerve of you serving that crap for $13. Of course this is my opinion and experience. Now let me go find the menu so it can be destroyed. No more office orders!
author: Sandy P.

description: Had the Philly cheesesteak sandwich with mushrooms and garlic fries. The sandwich was pretty flavorful. The garlic fries could use a bit more garlic, but we're still good. Service was great. The guy at the cashier later checked with us to see if everything was ok.
author: Shanelle A.

description:
I ate there today on my lunch break, and I'm already waiting to eat there again.  If you're looking for a non-greasy, healthy meal, this probably isn't the place - although they do have a few salads.

As a vegetarian & selective eater, I've become pretty picky about my veggie burgers.  Theirs was very tasty and I think they make the patties themselves.  VegBurger, Fries & soda came to $10.  Waffle fries were greasy and delicious.  :)

The two guys working were really nice.
author: Anna S.

description:
BEST GARLIC FRIES I'VE EVER HAD. 

Followed the scent of garlic fries from Mercury Lounge to this little cafe. These garlic fries are better than the Ballparks and Gordon Biersch.
