The best part of these fries is that they are super crunchy, salted and drenched in garlic oil instead of oil & bits of garlic. Boy are they potent though! Even though I wasn't eating bits of garlic I could still taste it in my mouth the next morning.

It was so good my friends and I polished off 3 orders. Maybe we were just hungry when midnight rolled around or maybe these were the perfect antidote to sober up after our shot of Crown. Either way I am definitely coming back!

Yummy!
author: Terry D.

description:
My boss frantically ran around the office asking if we wanted to order lunch from V Cafe. I'll admit, I looked at the menu and it was a bit sparse and weirdly fashioned. I'm not used to places which list sandwiches with no sides, etc. It can be a bit touch and go in SF. 

So I said to hell with it and got the double cheeseburger w/ fries.

Sure, I paid 11 bucks. What I got was what cheeseburger heaven is made of. The burger was cooked to my specification (med-rare) and was HUGE. Think Nation's huge (they do delicious burgers in Oakland too). The waffle fries were good, but really only served to soak up the excess grease in my mouth.

I felt bad, REAL BAD, eating this huge burger.

But not so bad I didn't repeat it the next week. I'm salivating just thinking about it now.
author: Chris M.

description: This place looks and feels like or hasn't been cleaned for months... The floor, tables, ketchup bottle were all sticky and gross.  The tried food was a 49er burger and an Italian beef sandwich.  The burger was fine, but the beef sandwich was dry and a bit bland.  Fries were good though.
author: dublin a.

description: Check the specials board for 6in. sammies, fries, and drink combo. perfect for lunch! I tried their fried shrimp po'boy special ($7.95+tax). Garlic fries weren't as garlicky as last time and were crispy. i prefer my fries soft. Maybe ill ask next time.
author: Carolyn J.

description: Cheesesteaks. Garlic fries. Beautiful fresh salad. Worked well with our two turdly sons. Enough said.
author: Casey C.

description:
Ok, so the tasty burger & garlic fries are 5* on the Nomi Greasey Tasty Scale.  So are the Po'Boys.  The people who work there are are super nice to the people in the hood.

So why only 3 stars you ask?  Because I can never tell when they are going to be open.  Seriously.  Wed eve? Closed.  Sunday afternoon? Closed.  If you walk by & they're open -- eat here.  I think they target busy club nights, which kind of sucks if you live in the 'hood and want a burger!
author: nomi c.

description: Really great food, fast service and friendly people. Looks a little grungy on the inside but great for takeout. Will be back!
author: Bob I.

description:
I live in the area, and I play in the area, so for these reasons V Cafe is well located.  However, it is NEVER OPEN!!!  Many a time we have had cravings for the delicious sandwiches V offers, and we walk there or ride over and alas, they are CLOSED again, even though their hours are posted as 'open'.  And don't be sad when you try it again next week and it happens to you once more.

So, lesson, do not be scared to try V because the inside, the menu, the people eating and working there look scary.  Also, do not excite yourself with the prospect of a sandwich for the realistic chance you walk over there and they are closed  -- - and then you are left to contend over the other slim slim prospects of eateries scattered about (There are a fair amount of places scattered about, but if I walked over here for a sandwich, I'm not going to want to pay Sushi Groove South prices.  You know what I mean.  I guess this is how we discovered Bowzers.)

Eh, so not bad, pretty tasty actually.  They best outcome is you take your sandwich over to Wish next door and have a merry time.
author: Leia K.

description: Ordered a couple sandwiches and salads for delivery during the great typhoon of 2014.  I had the Compromise and my gf had the Sellout.  Absolutely ridiculously delicious!  Filling, spicy (get the hot cherry peppers!!!) and relatively close (not the same though) as a true Philly cheesesteak (yes I have had a proper Philly and I realize that neither of us ordered a Philly but you can tell it's made from the right stuff).  The horseradish sauce put it over the edge.  Plus garlic waffle fries.  So garlicy and amazing!  This will be my new go to for lunch delivery sandwiches!
author: David P.

description: They have really awesome grilled cheese sandwiches and super friendly customer service! The waffle cut fries are pretty bomb too. But most importantly the lady working there was really nice and accommodating to my drunk friend's needs. Thank you V cafe :)
author: Patrick L.

description:
1. star for being open late
1. star for fast service with a smile late night
1. star for a decent cheese steak at 2am

For a late night snack spot, the food is pretty good, i don't know if i would necessarily go there if i wasn't starving after 1am tho. 

they had a WHIZ-LIKE cheese but, it didnt reaaaaallly taste like real whiz.
other than that, i suggest checking it out.
author: Shadi N.

description:
In a pinch this place worked out for providing greasy, late nite grub for myself and the beautious Molly R. as we held "80's Dance Party" in my apartment last Thursday... the delivery guy didn't even make fun of the fact that two girls had ordered two foot long cheesesteaks (w/extra cheese) and garlic fries AND chicken wings... not once.

It was fast delivery, too.  Under 30 minutes.  A little pricier than I had hoped, though... but, that's okay.  Anything for my Molly R. - my widdle snookums!

Goodish food, fast service, good selection of junk food, sucky prices... eh, okay I suppose four stars.  More like 3.5, really.
author: Kate R.

description:
We were looking for a good late-night place to try in SOMA, and based on the reviews thought we would give this one a try. On the positive side, the cashier was very friendly, and it's true that the sandwiches are large. Unfortunately, this just made me feel worse when my cheese steak was too gross to finish and I threw it away. 

From the moment it was set down in front of me, the smell seemed a bit off instead of enticing. I then took a bite. I don't think meat is supposed to made a weird noise when you chew it. I don't know if it's the quality of the meat or the way it was prepared, but it was just plain nasty. Being from the East coast, it just made me want Jersey Mike's. Think I'll pay them a visit as soon as I make it home.
author: Carissa G.

description:
The cheese steak subs are indeed huge.  Mine was 11.75 inches long.  After I finished eating, I had 5.5 inches left over.  The sub was an average of 3 inches wide and 2 inches tall.  

11.75 - 5.5 = 6.25.  6.25 x 3 x 2 = 37.5.  

Thus I ate 37.5 cu. in. of cheese steak sub tonight.  

Oh and the fries weren't bad either.
author: Sue Z.

description: I'm a bit surprised at how delicious the cheesesteak and fries were for this place, especially for delivery. The portion size was huge and well worth the 15 dollars minimum for delivery. The cheesesteak was juicy and the bread was fresh. I had mushroom and onions in it as well. Not sure if I had bell peppers but it tasted great! Going to order soon again :)
author: Yelper H.

description: Time I should give this very good eatery in Soma a review. Been coming here well over a dozen time over the last 2 years and always had a very decent meal here. This place is run very well and the staff are very welcoming and very friendly. Cheese steaks are very good and very large enough to split for two people !! I usually get the special, 1/2 cheese steak with garlic chip fries with a soda for less than 9 bucks, not bad!! They also have a decent selection of other sandwiches, burgers, salads and specials.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
You might come here for the cheesesteak sandwich, a wise and reliable option. 

Or you might come here for the turkey burger, vaguely healthier than the rest of the menu, and quite satisfying. 

But I come for the eggplant grinder. It's basically eggplant parmasan in a hoagie roll. Mmmm....yes....greasy and sinful, but hits the spot, especially on those days when you're going brain dead at work and need the complete antithesis to sophisticated intelligentsia.
author: Melinda K.

description:
Okay, first off, I definitely haven't had much experience with this place to judge their whole menu.  

But I can say with firm certainty that their popcorn shrimp sucks.  It's like 80 % corn dog batter and 20% tiny tiny shrimp --Quite deceptive if you ask me.  I'm not a big fan of the imperial rolls/egg rolls either.  

Maybe I just need to stay away from fried food from this place.  

I'll probably get the cheese steak the next time I come here.  That seems like a hit.  

On the upside, it's fast, fairly cheap, open late, and near a lot of clubs and bars in Soma---pretty expedient post-dancin' grub if you're in the area.
author: Tracy N.

description:
Better than Jay's (duh), but not as good as the Cheesesteak Shop. Still...every cheesesteak place in SF is different, and for the varieties they've got and the size they serve up (they're freakin' HUGE), you'll be in heaven there. The other day I took the second half of a bacon cheesteak home as leftovers from lunch, and that's an accomplishment in itself. 

IIRC they use toasted sourdough rolls, and I kinda like the softer rolls they use @ the Metro cafe in the Lower Haight  a bit better. Stay far away from the mozzarella sticks bas they suck major ass. The criss-cut fries tho? Off the HEEZY. I'd compare them to Chick-Fil-A's fries (the best IMO), which I was lucky enough to be raised on eons ago in the food courts of Paramus Park, New Jersey.
author: Justin H.

description:
Solid greasiness! 

GREAT Tuna Melt. 

Chili Cheese Fries are Awesome. Buffalo Tenders are Very Awesome. 

Mushroom Cheeseburger is very good but not spectacular. 

Salads are huge and tasty and sans the greasiness.
author: Norris T.

description: Great little hole in the wall...conveniently located! Excellent sammiches...just a few too many choices. Simplify! The cheese steak sammich with waffle fries came out in less than 5 minutes! Highly recommend! One was enough to share between the two of us!
author: Joel J.

description:
V Cafe makes me drool just thinking about their cheese steaks.  

Hey, are you looking at the menu?!  Cut it out!  I command you to order the combo A cheese steak with sweet peppers NOW!

Incidentally, it is bloody murder driving your takeout lunch back to office, cuz the sandwich and waffle fries smell so good, you're likely to keep glancing over at them and get into car accident.
author: Jason Y.

description:
This little place next to the Holy Cow has huge, delicious, garlicky (?!) cheesesteaks.  I mean HUGE.  Orange on a toothpick huge.  Big greasy burgers and criss-cut fries (discontinued?  NOOOOOOOOO).  My dining companion, the Flaming Carrot had the shrimp po-boy, which he liked okay, but he used to live in New Orleans, so he probably has higher sammich standards than I do.

Maybe not as authentic as the Cheesesteak Shop and never as good as Sonia's in San Jose, it's still nice to be able to get a good, greasy mush of meat and other shit in this part of town.

Extra bonus; they are open until 2am on weekends.  Extra, extra bonus; last time I went there late, after I ordered, I found my car had been blocked in by a fire engine with no firemen to be found.  Some very nice squids on Ducati Supersports noted my look of consternation and helped me guide my car through an opening that it wasn't meant to fit.  Thank you anonymous squids!  But I still lambast your lack of proper motorcycle gear.
author: Frankie D.

description:
i really would only go back in a pinch....a really hard pinch!

i wish my thin slab of kraft singles was melted on my cheese burger instead of resting raw-ly there.

i wish my fries were not so frozen tasting.

i wish that at 730 pm, 6 hours after i ate that burger and fries, my mouth didn't taste like a slightly digested version of it anymore :s

i have to give it 2 stars since i did finish the meal--that part is my bad.
author: Bad Ass Chic K.

description:
GARLIC FRIES!!!! 



(make sure whoever youre going to be kissing later eats them too)
author: Afton T.

description: V-cafe has best cheese steak sandwiches in the bay area!   The bread is perfect - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside just like it should be!   Their burgers are grade A as well.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.   I eat there at least once a week.   Be sure to take advantage of the sandwich stamp card - buy 10 get one free!
author: Joe S.

description:
Went here for lunch and got the half cheese steak + garlic fries for like $7. That's a pretty tough deal to beat.
The cheese steak was delicious. One of the better ones I've had in the city and the garlic fries were COVERED in garlic. They are in waffle fry form and don't have that green stuff that garlic fries typically have(chives?) but they were really good.
author: Kevan M.

description:
Definitely not a spot for the health-conscious, but if you're looking for the best cheesesteak in San Francisco, V-Café is worth the visit. 

My favorite has to be the mushroom and bacon cheesesteak, with garlic fries of course. Their chicken cheesesteak is not bad either. On those days when I'm feeling a little bit guilty, I'll nix the garlic fries and go with a plain turkey burger. 

It's a wonderful little gem; a heaven-sent gift for late night munchies when you're out in SOMA. Their items may be a little pricey, but the portions are HUGE! Two people could easily share a full-sized cheesesteak. If sharing is caring, then the prices seem pretty reasonable. But by far, the best deals are the house specials. I don't recommend taking the leftover home -- I did that once and ended up with a soggy sandwich. It was a greasy mess!
author: Leslie K.

description:
It was ok - got the mushroom cheesesteak with Swiss cheese..... to me it was a little bland though, and not enough onions, peppers, and mushrooms.  The bread was my least favorite part - it tasted stale.  It was HUGE though - so I think it's a pretty good value for the $$.  I got it delivered, so it may not have been as tasty as if I had it at the restaurant.  

I have come to the conclusion that I need to STOP being so lazy having food delivered.  I have been really slammed with work, but working from home this week - so instead of calling in for delivery I should have been taking the opportunity to get out and get some fresh air.  Now it's a Friday night and I'm grumpy from my miserable week of toiling away in my apartment all day and stuffing my face with mediocre food... BOOOOOOO for me!  Oh well, such is life.
author: A B.

description:
Terrible food of sub-Safeway quality
I ordered some Buffalo Wings and two sandwiches to be delivered
The food was gross and used low quality, days-old ingredients
The Buffalo wings were dry and drenched in cheap spicy bbq sauce
The PO-Boy Shrimp sandwich was greasy and quite disgusting
author: FOO D.

description:
I had lunch here last week and ordered a cheesesteak.  The cheesesteak was pretty good.  I asked them to substitute provolone for American cheese and they did.  I also ordered extra cheese but I don't think I actually got extra cheese.  Which kind of perturbs me, but whatever next time I'll order extra extra cheese and see what happens.  I think that if they had Whiz it would be a 5 star cheesesteak.  The meat and the onions are plentiful and well seasoned.  However I did get a mouthful of gristle that was a little unappealing.  The cheesesteak as is is 3 stars.

I have also had the burger here.  I was actually very impressed by the burger.  It was juicy, a little bit overcooked, but still juicy and they season the burger.  So many burger joints don't season the damn burger which drives me insane.  This place does.  I am sure the fat content of the ground beef is at least 25% which is fine by me and in my opinion the bacon cheeseburger was a winner.  I haven't had the fries there but I always see people eating them.  I can't really justify eating 1/2 pound of fries on top of a 800 calorie burger.  It's enough already.

All in all, I live and work around the corner and when I get a hankering for Jake's I go to V.... Because Jake's and Phat Philly don't deliver to me anymore.  Jake's I guess because I moved from Nob Hill to SOMA, which I can understand.  Phat Philly I don't really understand.  When they first opened up they delivered to me but don't anymore.
author: Anthony Y.

description: This place is not bad at all ... nice location ( to me anyway ) and a nice little menu to choose from .. sandwiches hot or cold, salads, lots of choices .... although today I was put off a lil ... just wanted a little salad for lunch ... the house salad i guess it is ... from the bat it was good ... nice greens in there some little orange slices with walnuts and cranberries .. all was going well then there it was fly # 1 dead and just hanging out in the salad ... I am really not one to complain so i pushed it to the side and hoped i would not spot .... oh wait there it is another one in here ... so that was it the salad lost me I had to toss it ... i enjoy some extra protein with any meal but cant be having a family of flies in my salad ... usually a good place ... not so much this time ...
author: Anthony S.

description:
ehh....it'll do.....it''s open late...and you're pretty wasted....it'll do.

Ordered the philly cheesesteak sandwich....more like the steak sandwich....there was NO cheese really...and i'm big on cheese....and the chicken tenders were AIGHTTTT..

come here if you are pissed off pete drunk....nothing earth-shattering
author: Dessa R.

description:
The cheese steak --- super big and greasy and yummy goodness.

The burgers --- I love 'em.  'Specially the mushroom cheeseburger.

I always ask for medium rare and one time it was overcooked.  But come on....this isn't about quality...this is about lunch after a hangover or just for plain comfort...

The garlic fries are mega-garlicky and I thank V for that!
author: Dwayne A.

description:
Sweet, merciful Jesus I love this place. Great steak sandwiches and garlic fries, good chicken sandwiches, but don't bother with the salads.

During lunch, I'll have a steak sandwich served any way I can think of and listen to bad yet oddly charming 80's music. The sandwich will be awesome, the fries may or may not be transcendent, and I've never had a salad. They have them on the menu but I'd stay away. I've only seen one person order one and it looked like the lettuce had been there for far too long.  They're open for dinner as well but I think the food is better during the day.  If you're coming from one of the bars or clubs near by, well, maybe the sandwiches are better at night.

I don't know how many times I've eaten here but I'm sure it's stripped years of my life and I think it's worth it. I'm not from Philly and I won't pretend to be a cheese steak expert but this place is tasty. It used to be called Whiz Wit (a call to Philly aficionados out there) but was sold and renamed V Cafe. The chef that made Whiz Wit was brought back, however and bad ass steak sandwiches were once again available to to Mission/SOMA border region. Thank god. 

My only complaint about V is that the fries are inconsistent. Usually they are waffle-cut, the Cadillac of Frenched fried potato, but sometimes they serve crinkle-cut, kinda freezer-burned fries instead. Also, the garlic fries are sometimes want for garlic. When the fries are right, and you get a steak sandwich and let the grease from the sandwich drip into the pile of potatoes....a better fry you will never have.
author: Rob I.

description: Very good hole in the wall in SOMA. I frequent this establishment to the point where all I need to do is nod and throw up a finger, yup...good stuff and they always do me right.....
author: Dennes H.

description: Great food, friendly staff, clean bathrooms, and cheap.  What more could you ask for?  Also, we went there around 8:30-9:00, so they're open later than the hours posted on yelp.
author: Cody Z.

description:
Stopped in for some lunch today.  It was alright and I left satisfied with their cheesburger & fries.  Their not that pricey if you consider the fact that fries are included with the price of their sandwiches.  But if you're hungry and in the area, it's worth a stop.

The reason why they get only 3 stars you ask?  Someone stopped in looking for "Big Nate's BBQ", which is just a block down the street, and they were jerks and didn't even answer the guy.  Finally I had to speak up and tell the couple that was asking.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
THE closest thing you will get to an authentic Philly Cheesesteak in San Francisco (screw Jay's). Seriously, awesome cheesesteaks.

I just wish I was near V's more often or at least near it when it was opened.
author: David F.

description:
I don't know why places do it like this but for a NORMAL single human sized meal, get a half order. Thats the #1 advice for going here.
Good tasty cheesesteaks, and cross cut fries, for 8$ though it's slightly high, but thats ok if your in that area.
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
I'd give it a 3.5 stars if I could.  It's greasy goodness and 5 stars after you hit the bars if you know what i mean.  Just so you know they open late.  

But for a lunch place, it is $1-2 over what it's worth and you start tasting the quality of the sandwich when you're sober.  They skimp on the mushrooms as well, so beware.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
I have been going to this place off and on for the last three years and they are excellent. They have a variety of American cuisine at reasonable prices. They staff is super friendly and get orders out quick; which means a lot if you are on a lunch break.

Not anything super healthy on the menu (even the salads) but of course you would not want to eat like this daily.

Definitely a treat.
author: Amber A.

description:
Don't believe the hype.

If you're partying in the vastly over-rated part of SoMA near the V, and it's 2 am and you're wasted, then yeah, you will dig this sandwich and te garlic fries will be amazing.

Otherwise, it's a wasted trip - usually because they're freaking closed. Ignore the posted hours and whatever the telephone recording tells you, these guys are never open, it seems, if it's not after midnight. How many times have I tried to get a damn sandwich just to walk a few blocks and see the metal gate down? And, the one time I got a cheesesteak sober, it was pretty basic.

So, drunk of yer ass on a Saturday night = great, filling grub that won't be talking to you all night like a burrito.
Any other time, it's a let down of a sandwich...and they're probably closed anyway.
author: That Was A Good Drum Break ..

description: This place is terrible.  I ordered a salad because it was suppose to come w/ avocado, it didn't.  I ordered a chicken cheesesteak and it was so greasy it made me nauseous.  Not to mention the hot peppers on the side I ordered, were not delivered.  Now I am fully aware that cheesesteaks in all their forms are greasy, but this was beyond the pale.  And whomever was explaining the whole fried food/chinese food connection to the burgers, can also make the connection w/ the steak samiches.  There is just this old wok oil flavour that accompanies the food.  And the mozzarella sticks were sub-par.  They were soggy and sitting in marinara sauce.  Do they not have to-go souffle cups for that?  I will never eat their food again.  Even drunk I would pass.  McDonald's has a better chance of seeing me there after a night of drinkies.
author: Heather S.

description: I stopped in to grab a quick lunch during a one-day job at the hip trendy branding agency next door. I had the crispy chicken salad to go. The surprisingly tasty and plentiful chicken seemed to be fried in light tempura or just a teensy bit of panko. Very friendly service. Not a destination restaurant for sure but a good value when you're in that neighborhood and want some good old-fashioned fried food.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: For what it is, good. Had the veggie burger that comes with fries, for $8 with tax and cheese not bad. I think they use Boca patties, they crisp them upon the griddle and with cheese its the perfect texture. Nice soft sesame buns, fresh 'fixins'. Waffle fries are crispy, not greasy. Good lunch under $10. I do wish they had more veggie things, the seitan cheesesteak at Jay's for example is the best.
author: Cori W.

description: Great experience at every bite. No I m not from philadelphia, but I know when a cheestake sandwich is good. The most legite in my best in town it is the chicken mushrooms cheestake. The Cristian cut fries also said something, I m not your average Joe.
author: Alex M.

description: Get the letter "A" special - half cheesesteak with sweet peppers, garlic fries and soda. You won't be hungry the rest of the day. These folks are very nice and their dishes are tasty and very filling. Really. Cut it in half or share it unless you're trying to gain weight on purpose.
author: Eric M.

description: Great salads, juicy sandwiches and open late. What more could you ask for?
author: Larry F.

description:
1 stars for being open super late in the SOMA area....

cant go wrong with quality cheese steak sandos at 2 am.  I wouldn't call these authentic philly steak ones but still very solid quality cheese steaks for sure.

1 star for cheese sauce

fries are pretty awesome too, owner gave me a free basket once because my order took so long.... 

1 star for quick service... even with a long line when holy cow gets out.
author: Shawn A.

description:
Good greasy cheese steak, but i think the cherry peppers that they use should not be cooked and they need to add a bit more cheese to the cheese steak. I think it was OK, but the meat did have any flavor it was just meat.   This place is a bit pricey but for a 12" it might be OK. 

I ate at this place today for lunch. they had fast service, the place looked clean, But the price was just a bit high for a lunch sandwich.

this wouldn't be a place that i would drive across town for.
author: steve a.

description: Wow! Nice and clean. The people are wonderful. The place stays open late. The food is so good it's sinful. I enjoy it every time I go there, every time.
author: John H.

description: YES! They're open. Late night grub. Great subs and burgers, onion rings, and fries. Limited seating area.
author: Stanley K.

description: Veggie burger smells like weed. Not in a good way. Hours wildly unpredictable. Paint job could cause seizures.
author: Ben G.

description: I had the cheese steak and onion rings....really good stuff if you need some grease in your life! The portions are huge though. More order was more than enough for 2 people. Delivery was seamless and with in the time frame they gave me.
author: Raven D.

description: They claim to serve the best classic cheese steak sandwiches in town and, considering they're much better than any I've had elsewhere (especially Jay's on Divisadero), I assume there's truth in their advertising. Their version is made with grilled onions, sweet or hot cherry peppers, and your choice of American, provolone, Swiss, cheddar, or jack. They also serve a variety of salads, burgers and hearty grinders, with fillings like salmon, meatballs, eggplant parmigiana, or po-boy fried shrimp. Make sure you order a side of fries.
author: Gourmet G.

description: If you are a fan of philly cheese steaks, this a great hole in the wall you need to checkout. Their cheese steaks are larger than life with tons of meat and just enough peppers to compliment each bite without being too overwhelming. You'll want to make sure you drizzle their hot sauce onto each bite as well.
author: R B.

description: V might merit an extra star if I try the cheesesteak, but that's never going to happen, so I give it a 3.  The crepe I had was presented as a wrap.  The waffle fries were decent.  There's a few tables and counter space for those wanting to dine in.  But they also offer delivery and take-out.
author: Marsha Z.

description: Yeap, good fried food. I had 2 sandwiches there and they aren't spectacular.
author: Razza M.

description: They have criss-cross fries here that give me a warm and fuzzy feeling in my tummy.
author: Laura G.

description: Besides the fact that I was starving and would eat anything, this place was super delish :d I hadn't eaten yet and was drinking at Holy Cow next door... so it was an opportune stop. I had the chicken pesto sandwich, the first night. I let my friend have the other half, he was equally satisfied with it. So satisfied that the next night we went out of our way to stop there for another sandwich after the club. Again it was great. This time we ordered fries with it, the fries were you basic frozen crimp fries, nothing to rant or rave about. They're open late and have tasty yum ranch dressing.
author: Deb B.

description: My former hangover central.  BLT with avocado?  I think so.  Or grilled cheese with tomato.  Yumminess.  But basically it's overpriced costco food.  Sometimes it's what you need though.  I could go for one RIGHT NOW.  Don't get the turkey sandwich or turkey burger though.  Just trust me on this one.
author: Coco D.

description:
so, after having a college-like experience next door, you might wanna catch up on the college-type grub...

but even without the experiences to be had next door, i will come back to the v cafe, because they had awesome cheesesteaks!  and they're huge!

they had lots of combinations, ranging from an omelette on a bun, to the classic cheesesteaks with onions, provolone and plenty of beef.  

very tasty, and a great deal!
author: Jill k.

description:
this is the second of my 2 favorite restaurants after a night out in SF. not only do they serve unbelievably good cheesesteaks (my personal favorite is the pizza 'steak with tomato sauce, bell peppers, etc) and chili fries, i've also had some of the most hilarious conversations in my life at these tables. vive l'asian-owned cheesesteak shops!

p.s. part 1 of 2 favorites is yuet lee over on stockton
author: Jane C.

description: This place has kick ass cheese steak subs made however you want it.  Lots of other stuff too that sounds good but I can never resist the cheesesteak.  The waffle fries are pretty damn good as well.
author: Derek D.

description: Not a greasy-spoon hash-slinging kind of diner, but an epic throw-down to the days of hamburger and cheesesteak-yore. This is a stoner's best friend. Try some.
author: E.Mo. ..

description: If you're really into going to a posh/chic environment this isn't the place for you. BUT if you want really good cheese steak sandwiches, garlic fries, onion rings then you should definitely check this place out! VERY good good.
author: Joon Y.

description: When I'm seriously ready for some food that will make my body sink into itself from pure volume (ramble ramble), I stop by V to get a cheese steak.  They're definitely of the filling nature, and the fries are great, although I can't tell the difference between the plain fries and the garlic fries sometimes.  Small place, quick service, not a cheap-o place though...
author: Asha H.

description: Okay, not only do I love the fact that they have free delivery and are on eat24.com but the food is freakin fantastic!  Highly recommend!
author: Nichole V.

description: God i feel fat. I mean really fat. I just downed one of those delicious chicken cheese steak hogies (hold the mustard) wtih fries and a coke. I then went over to Hot Cookie and got a toffee milk chocolate cookie. However, I didn't eat immediately. I waited until i got home and had a pint of vanilla ice cream. I then heated up the cookie put the ice cream on top and watched Entourage. I feel fat lazy and pretty much AWESOME. Thank you V cafe and Hot Cookie.
author: John S.

description: Man wish that you could order something smaller than the $4.95 portion of onion rings.  The fries were not as good today and the cheesesteak just wasn't as good as I remembered... doh
author: Gene X.

description:
i like the burgers here, theyre, umm, sloppy.

like a half drunk BBQ attempt in your back yard with the old webber. it doesnt matter how it looks, if it has some dirt on it or a lil ash, when you finish up and take a bite, youre nothing but satisfied and smiling a greasy grin.

crosscut fries arent my potato of choice,but whatever, the 1/2 pound of dead cow is good.
author: Darrell L.

description: Pretty good sandwich place. I had the 6-inch cheese steak with mushrooms and a side of their signature criss-cross garlic fries. I liked the fries a lot, which were quite garlicky. However, my sandwich lacked flavor and needed a lot of hot sauce, jalapeno peppers and red chili paste. There was also very little mushroom in my sandwich.
author: Jenny K.

description: omfg what happened to this place. I had a cheesesteak here a year ago and it was fantastic, I was sober. Tonight, drunk as a mofo, I couldn't choke it down. yech.
author: Erik W.

description: found a flyer from these guys a couple of years ago, otherwise I probably would have never found out about them.  the burgers are pretty good, fries are crisp and salty (cheese fries::drools::) the cheesesteaks are huge, along with the chicken hoagies. Not super cheap, but when I don't feel like lugging myself out to safeway for dinner ingredients, v cafe will do quite nicely
author: Marie W.

description: Great in a pinch, or a budget or in a drunken stupor requiring something in the tum tum to soak up all the booze you've ingested from the handful of bars only a stone's throw away.  I love(loath) the buffalo chicken tenders, the chicken cheese steak w/ shrooms, the grilled cheese sandwich, and they have WAFFLE FRIES w/ cheese(or yellow cheese flavored goop) as a option!  I've sworn them off countless times and said Hello almost as many.
author: Chard M.

description: Mmm greasy goodness!  The lunch specials at V are the best deal--you can get a half cheesesteak (which is really the size of a regular cheesesteak) plus garlic fries and a soda for $8.  Or a full turkey burger, which I actually like better than their regular burgers.  Make sure they remember to put the garlic on the garlic fries--the regular fries just don't cut it.
author: Kevin H.

description:
One letter multiplied many times over.

Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm, is all I can say about this place. It isn't your straight from Philly, cheesesteak of cheesesteaks. Lack of cheese whiz equates to the authenticity, but REGARDLESS this place makes great great great food. Food comes out nice and hot, the steak is very well prepared, and the service is friendly. Don't bring your calorie counter with you through the door, if you dont wanna be in for a scare. I've had two mushroom cheesesteaks from here before in one session, and as delicious as it was, I did feel quite miserable after. Def-Rec.
author: V T.

description:
been coming for YEARS!

i once had a cheese steak from philly.  maybe it was the 5 hour flight when my then bf hand carried it back for me that ruined it, but i was not impressed.

only because the sweet goodness of v cafe is all i could ever hope for in a cheese steak.

and i drove by today, only to find - THEY'RE OPEN SUNDAY'S NOW?!?!? oh, so many sunday's wasted!  =(
author: Christine P.

description: I used to come here for lunch often.  The cheese steak is ok -- well actually it was pretty bad (dry, tasteless).  I've had better on the East coast.  I like their burgers a lot, but don't get them to go.  The buns get really soggy in the styrofoam container.  The teriyaki burger is gross (teriyaki sauce on a burger).  The fries are cool if you like those grid ones.  So basically not a bad lunch place, but nothing special.  OH, the pesto chicken sub looks delicious and gigantic, but I've never had it.
author: Avi H.

description: Get the Chicken Caeser Salad or the garlic fries!
author: John S.

description: seriously dense sammiches. you will gain a pound just smelling it.
author: Tom H.

description: Okay look, if you want healthy food, screw it.  BUT FLIP if you want a good sandwich this place is awesome and they are friendly.  We tripped onto this place after a boring night at Ruby Skye and my friend dragged us to the Holy Cow.  This place has garlic fries to die for.  I know they are known for their cheese steak, which I have yet to try since I'm so in love with the NY Steak Sandwich.  I love it.  It's so simple, yet tasty and I love every delicious bite.  I would have never ever ever ever gone here just by the looks or even looking at it on yelp since I generally don't find this type of food too interesting, but something about this place and their sandwiches are heavenly and fantastic.  They're friendly and they remember me as the girl who orders the same thing every time, but I love it.  LOVE IT.  I'd come here every chance if I could.  But yeah, I don't know when they're open sometimes.  But definitely open after a night out.
author: Josephine C.

description:
UPDATE 1-25-08:

Ok - they are not closed.  For some reason, they were not accepting new orders for a few days.  Sorry peeps!  Happy grubbin....

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

UPDATE 1-12-08:

V CAFE is closed!!!  This Sucks!!!  Now where am I going to get my chicken cheesesteak fix WITH delivery??!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Update 12-17-07:

I can now order through eat24hours.com and have the food delivered.  My new fav is the chicken hoagie.  Yummy!  And it is huge for only 7 bucks!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Awesome food....when you are buzzed and needing some fatty shit.  Try the Philly!
author: James B.

description: My first time here, I was in for a meeting and had nothing to eat, but damn did it smell good in there. I came back around a month later and BAM! That's a good f-ing cheesesteak.
author: Jorge H.

description: I always use to come here for lunch during work for burgers and sandwiches. The taste and quality to me seem great, but I feel the price is a just a little high (by about $1-3).  And when I recently went back, it just didn't feel the same to me as before anymore.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
The fish and chips, really filing. At just over $9 after tax it is quite a rewarding meal.

I've had a few burgers here that are just alright, but the fish and chips keeps me coming back. That and the friendly service.
author: Anthony A.

description: Not as good as the Cheesesteak Shop, but a strong showing.  Excellent fries and generally large portions.
author: James B.

description: Pretty damn good food, i love the sellout sandwich and their garlic fries. WAY over priced though. you can spend like 11 bucks on one sandwich and fries, and it doesn't quite taste like an 11 dollar sandwich. i went here 10 times, just enough to fill up one sandwich card. i will go to get my free sub soon, but after that, it just wont be worth it to return. definitely good for a little while though.
author: J. G.

description: pretty good cheesesteak and i'm from philly.  i'll be back.  it was a quick lunch so i didn't get to thoroughly enjoy.  next time
author: Hammer Time H.

description: take-out or delivery, I've always been highly fatly thrilled. it's a major decision picking what to eat, everything is delish-tacular. from the cheesesteak to the burgers to the sinfully divine grilled cheese, I am a devoted patron. the fries ? they taste like the potatoes were blessed by the Pope Himself. and the fish & chips ! can't ever forget how excellent those were (gotta cajole for an extra malt vinegar though, they only give one tiny Solo cupful). how good is V ? my pals on 46th Ave. waaaaaaaay down in the Sunset drive all the waaaaaaaay across town to 11th St. -- now you be the judge
author: Prima D.

description: i eat here sometimes because they deliver to my place of work. today for lunch, i ordered cheese fries and a fried egg and cheese sandwich. i don't know what i was expecting. i got a mountain of fries covered in velveeta-y goodness. disappointed at the lack of actual sliced cheese, but hungry, i delved into the fat mountain and ate each and every single fry. i still can't bring myself to eat the egg and cheese sandwich. it's just too much. how am i supposed to eat twelve inches of liquid cheese and fried eggs?
author: Oleya P.

description: when im in this area called the mo town (fillmoe st)~u can find me here~this place is good any time of the day~from lunch or till the late hours of the 2am meals lol...which is a plus~jus dont get distracted by the drunk foolios comin out of the cow next door...u kno what im talkin about....huuuuge sandwich portions with chesse fries is all mine...itll compete wit great steak at the malls or jays in the mission....
author: elmer d.

description: oh cheese steaks! this place will lessen the number of years you are on the planet. the menu is made of aluminum, that's awesome. i walk here from work and grab a philly or something, normally one sandwich is enough for me -the fries will put you over the edge.
author: Ameer N.

description: love love love this place, even though it's not as good as it *used* to be.  a couple of years ago, my bf and i used to come here about 3 times a month. now, not so much because of the work schedule but when i'm ever in the area, thats my spot! the mom and son are sooo sweet. super nice and laid back and they remember you.  they change chefs every now and then so it's starting to become a hit or miss with the taste of the meat but they have the best criss-cut garlic fries! salads are huge and it comes with bread but they don't carry butter.  best part is that they open late on thursdays, fridays and saturdays (to cater to the nightlife in the area) but will occasionally close before 7:30 on weekdays if it's slow. average tab for 2 people is about $25 with tax, tip and drink.  the spot isn't that big, i'd say come with a group of 4 or less, if you come with more than 10 people, i think that's max capacity. huge portions and don't forget to get the garlic fries!
author: Yien S.
